Love it. Funky quirky gifty stuff. Healthy yummy smoothie bar and cafe. Quaint and limited natural foods selection + craft beers and wine.

I had a wonderful brunch with my boyfriend today. The food and service was excellent and I love a place that does breakfast all day. A plus is that they offer vegan and low cholesterol options for meat. Luci's little market filled with cute knick knacks from socks to notebooks.

My friend and her husband told me about this place since they know I:
1) love a good cup of joe, 2) am a bit of a health nut (arguably contradictory with #1 I know), and 3) like to support local/family-owned businesses.  That being said, it seemed Luci's was a match made in heaven.  

I agree with the majority of the other Yelpers that the coffee is pretty good.  I love the fact that they offer unsweetened vs. regular/vanilla soy because my usual poison of choice is a caramel soy latte but it's usually too sweet for me unless the unsweetened soy is used (how I make it myself at home).  Anyways, so the coffee is pretty great, and the food was decent, but I think it's a bit pricey for what you get.  I ordered an omelette which was tasty but the potatoes weren't that flavored or special.  

The service can be a bit unpredictable, perhaps because the one time we had bad service was on a weekend vs. the other times I've gone during the week...I know that's not an excuse, just an observation.  My friend's wife ordered a macchiato but apparently they didn't know what that was even though that was on the menu, and the girl at the register messed up on our order 3 times.  

Despite all that, I would still go back for the coffee, and wouldn't mind ordering their food again.  Also, they have a cool selection of vegan/gluten free/organic products to check out while you're waiting for your order.

Oooooh...I picked up a small chicken salad for lunch the other day and took a bite in the car.  Totally rancid!  I took it back in and the owner said "Give her something else, no charge"  The next thing I ordered was a turkey wrap, which the staff member pulled out of the same under refrigerated container.  The health department should take a look before someone gets sick.
I called the owner and he said he would "look into it"
Also, way too expensive for what you get

I guess the environment is somewhat special because it's different than usual since there are groceries, food, and coffee. However I would not pay $10 for a burrito here again. There was nothing special about it. The coffee also wasn't special for $6. Overall, cool environment. Decent food.

We were all in town from places far and wide for a Thanksgiving in the sun and to share our Thanksgiving meal.  Tough to prepare that expansive feast in an unknown kitchen with unknown tools.  We didn't want our Thanksgiving dinner at a sit-down restaurant since we had rented a nice place on the border of South Mountain Park.  We opted instead for Luci's carry-out Thanksgiving meal with a bit of trepidation.  Was it going to be good... were they going to remember the cranberry relish... was the Fall salad going to be comprised of wilted lettuce?  We were a group of five and we unanimously each gave it five stars.  Not quite the same when you are cooking it yourself but as close as we thought you could get.  We picked up two large boxes on Thanksgiving day at 11am and with minimal prep had the meal on the table after a nice hike at 4pm.  They provided clear directions for the final finishes and it turned out great.  It met and beat our expectations by a wide margin.  Staff on the phone when we ordered and staff at Luci's when we arrived had us in and out in a matter of minutes with smiles and well wishes.  That Fall salad... no wilted lettuce to be seen but only fresh goodness!  Well done, folks!

Luci's is one of my favorite places in all of Phoenix. As a Realtor, it's usually difficult to plan where I'm going to eat lunch on any given day, but if I'm within a 5 mile radius of Luci's, I always go to Luci's. Their lunch menu is well made and healthier than almost anything else you're going to find a fast-food-type place and their coffee is delicious. I've never had a bad meal there and the staff is always friendly and prompt.

If you haven't been to Luci's before, add it to your to-do list this week.

Also, they have free wi-fi!

This place is right next to my house. I used to go a lot more often but i have realized they are the most expensive coffee in the area for the least tasty coffee. The baristas this don't make great coffee but they are really nice! It's a great place to sit and get some work done. They offer food which is reasonably priced. However, it is inconsistent - sometimes delicious but sometimes really bad. I like the "dirty doctor" melt and have learned not to experiment (don't get the lavash pizza!!!). They also have very hip groceries (for the organic soccer mom). Honestly i like the place but i usually go to the starbucks across the street now because the coffee is both better and less expensive. I hope they read this and dramatically improve their coffee!!! I will happily come back!!! Until then there are too many good options nearby (lola, lux, copperstar, shine, and even- gasp- sbucks).

How to lose a devoted local business supporter to Starbucks: So, here's my story. I go to Luci's first thing in the morning, just before 7am. I'm the only person in line. It's broad daylight but they have these lights on overhead, and they need replacement, so two of them are blinking. Constantly. The thing about strobing lights is, if you have a disability, like I do, blinking lights can cause serious problems. Like seizures and ocular migraines. That's why theatres and concert venues have to put signs out warning people when they use them. So, I tell the barista that the lights are blinking and that they can cause seizures and that I need him to turn them off. He says, "okay!" And then proceeds to do... nothing. I wait. He didn't call a manager. Didn't take my order or ask how he could make me more comfortable or express concern. He *did* fix three more drinks while I stood there in obvious discomfort and he didn't do anything to serve me. And then I left. And went to the Starbucks across the street. 
Then I emailed Luci's and told them what happened. And just like that effing barista, they did... nothing. Didn't respond. No "I'm so sorry, we fixed the lights and spoke with the barista." No "Here's a coupon for your next drink, please come back, sorry we completely disregarded your disability." Just... ignored me. 
Then I emailed them again and expressed dismay that they absolutely ignored me. And they ignored *that.* 
And that, my friends, is how you lose a devoted local-business-only shopper... to Starbucks. Never going to Luci's again, because they suck.

This is a unique little hang out spot. I've held a few business meetings here and drink selection is fantastic and the food is delicious. Hang around and shop their unique selection of healty stuff and novelties.

I had one of the best salads I've ever had here. I'm usually hard to please when it comes to finding a hearty, healthy and filling salad but the Quinoa Goji Berry Super Salad was INCREDIBLE. I'm in town for a few days for work and it looks like I'm going to go there for coffee, breakfast, and lunch the next few days.
Amazing staff! Our order was made wrong and manager didn't hesitate to make it right. Great food and awesome iced coffee!!!!
First time in Lucy's :) amazing service, and the breakfast burrito bomb was great. Definitely coming back here again to try something else on the menu :)

This is a great place- EXCEPT- 

the employees start shutting down at least 45 minutes to an hour early whenever the owner isn't present. They herd everyone out right at closing time (after cleaning the place an hour before closing while you are trying to eat ). Prospective customers came in TWO NIGHTS in a row asking for coffee - around 8:30 the first night and 8:45 the second- and they were told that the registers had been shut down and that they could not purchase anything. 

Too bad- the owner is a class guy. However, unless he corrects this people will not come due to the tight parking and flippant employees.

Dear Luci, 

I love you, I really do. I look forward to my first drink of coffee from you as soon as I wake up. I love spending my spare time at your sister location. I know if I've had a cup of joe from Luci's my day is off to a good start. However, the fact that I have to wait KILLLLS me. I can't understand why 80% of the time only one person is working in the morning - I waited for a drink on Tuesday for 7 minutes, on a Friday when they had two/three people I waited 12 minutes..this doesn't include the line time that I waited to just place my order. - maybe you make me wait so I'll buy Chachkies..if that's the case well played.

Luci's is a cute marketplace located in the epicenter of what is quickly becoming the hottest area in the 602 for locally owned outstanding businesses.

My first experience with Luci's was after having dinner at The Garage, my pal I and wanted to grab a coffee. We went in at about 9:30, and I was surprised to find two Debbie Downers working the counter. I tried to make a small joke, to see if these were people, or if the zombie uprising was starting, but I am still uncertain.

Grabbed a coffee and cupcake and called it a night. The coffee was good and the cups were pretty cool, they had a built in heat sleeve, so you are wasting less paper. The cupcake was ok, but nothing to start a Facebook fan page over.

Second visit was again after a visit to The Garage (hey, I am a simple creature) this time on a Friday at lunch. Happily, I had a complete different experience, and the staff were downright sweet. There were five people in my group, and I was ordering/paying for us all. After ordering two drips, and a mocha, the girl happily expressed, "Oh, I thought this was going to be a much more difficult order." It was kind of silly and sweet, almost like she meant to think that, and not say it, but her intentions were good, so I just told her we like to keep things simple. Walking over to prepare my coffee, another employee warmly greeted us and asked what we were up to today. It was a nice exchange, and it was great reflection on the place. I will chalk up my first experience to people being tired, I think we've all had days like that and no harm done.

Solid three. The. Place and the Feel is great. I wish they could follow with food well made. I have had the BLT and the 2 other food items that were made in the kitchen...all three times were a let down. I have the pre-made food from now on. 

I want to give 4* but they have to earn it.

|RL|

Note: LGO still wins as my fav brunch place.

Lucis is my favorite! I go there at least once a week.  I live in the neighborhood, and this is definitely a great addition to our area. I love the pomegranate citrus iced tea and the burrito bomb. Yum! Staff is very nice too. It's a good place to meet a client and they have decent wifi.

Hip little breakfast/brunch spot in Uptown Phoenix area. It's boasted as a marketplace as they do have lots of beer/wine/environmentally friendly products/goofy Knick knack gifts from magnets to books, print socks and tons of things crazy cat ladies will love.  It's a great spot for weekend brunch and coffee meet ups but it can get packed quickly so get there early. The menu is full of breakfast options from egg sandwiches to big full size flapjacks and lox and bagels and breakfast burritos to cure your hangover. They also have sandwiches and salads for quick on the go options and grab and go bottled drinks. The food is delicious and cooked to order and many can be gotten gluten free or veggie options. The coffee is above average and beats out Starbucks for sure and is still priced around the same as them or even less. If you've never been, I highly recommended checking it out. Come for the food and coffee, stay for the goofy marketplace.

Most of the employees here are so nice and goofy. I love it! 

My first time, I ordered a ham and provolone wrap with a tomato tortilla with a side of tater tots, a kale salad, and a sipp soda.
-The wrap was delicious! It was fresh and flavorful!
-I tried my mom's french toast and it was so good! I think it had cinnamon in it! 
-Lastly, the kale salad would of been enjoyable but the kale was overly bitter and I felt bad, but I had to return it. I HATE returning stuff. The employees there were so nice about it though, thankfully. 

On other occasions I had the turkey burger, the Madison Lavash, mimosa, and a caff√© caramel.
-The burger was good. Juicy and flavorful.
-The flatbread was BOMB! Very crispy and full of flavor. You must try it! 
-They were very generous on the mimosa if you know what I mean ;) and it was only $3! Winning!
-The caff√© caramel was good. Mellow and sweet just how I like it. 

Unfortunately, they messed up my parents plates once, tried to fix it, and forgot the main ingredients again. It was a wreck. Lol

I will say that parking sucks but that must mean something of the businesses parking lot is full. I also like that they have a mini market inside! I would compare this place to La Grande Orange but a smaller place. I SMELL COMPETITION!

I've had my eye on Luci's for a long time, but never made it out this way because it's just a touch too far from my house for breakfast. But, crashing in Phoenix for a while, I thought this was the perfect opportunity to check it out. We came here on a Saturday morning around 9, and there was no wait to order or for a table. 

I had the egg sammie, with cheddar and sausage on an Asiago bagel. I was looking for something pretty simple and no frills, but this sandwich was amazing. I had prepared myself for a big ole mess, like most breakfast sandwiches are--especially on a bagel. But the sausage and cheese were folded into the egg, frittata-style, which made for very handy eating. Also... no joke, this was the best bagel I've had in the state of Arizona. It was dense, in a great bagely way, but somehow very soft even though it was toasted. And it even reheated well! The guy is going through an ultra-health kick, so he opted for an a√ßa√≠ bowl. It was very tasty, but I think could've been just a touch more frozen/less runny. Also just a touch pricey, but I guess a√ßa√≠ bowls usually are. 

We both had mimosas, because how can you turn them down then they're $3? I certainly don't have that kind of willpower. They were a touch sweeter than I like, but I fully acknowledge that when I make my own mimosas, they're 96% champagne with 4% juice. And definitely not bad at all for $3. 

My favorite part of Luci's for sure were all of the little knick knacks to peruse while you're waiting. Lots of fun AZ things and things no one needs, aka the best things to look through always. 

Midway through our meal, we started planning our next trip back. How could we not, when there are so many tasty-sounding menu items to try? :)

Luci's Healthy Market Place started off with big promise, but lately has really slipped in the areas of customer service and cleanliness.  Offering breakfast, lunch and dinner, the place is cozy, fun and inviting. We love the Saturday Night Jazz and the great "small bites" from Chef Larry are the highlight of our week. He's personable, knowledgeable and a great Chef. We LOVE the food on Saturday, but can't say the same for during the week.  

Food has been sloppy, uneven on occasions, and plates are often messy during the weekday meals. Spotty shortages and lack of consistence makes for an frustrating experience. 

The coffee bar had great promise as well, but lately, Customer Service and Sanitation and organization has been spotty. Employees are often overwhelmed and look distracted, and the cafe is often messy and looks unclean.

If Luci's keeps up with the cleanliness, Customer Service and stays true to it's pleasant neighborhood concept, it'll do really well. Lots of competition now on this corner. 

Don't drop the ball, guys !  Management and the kitchen needs to step it up and keep us coming back !

I'm in love.  And, when you are in love, even the flaws just add to the perfection of a person (didn't you know that?).  So, even though there are some small "imperfections", Luci's is a definite 5-star place.  I LOVE THEM.  I am seriously considering setting up a cot in the store... then I could wake up and have the most delicious coffee (mocha, always) and fabulous service without going to the effort of leaving my house.  Hmm... think they'd let me?  

Luci's has quickly become my most favorite neighborhood spot.  It is obviously helpful that it is super-close to my house... but there are plenty of other coffee places within a reasonable distance and no one comes close.  The entire concept is just genius - breakfast, lunch, dinner, bakery, cooking classes, cleaning products (all natural, of course), homeopathic remedies, locally sourced produce - my list could go on and on... 

My most favorite thing about Luci's - their service.  I can't even begin to describe how awesome their baristas and chefs are - everyone is so sociable and friendly. Who wouldn't like to come here?  Not only are they good at making drinks and food - but they'll even recommend some good music for you to add to your itunes collection.  Love it!

Of course, their food/drinks are pretty awesome too - I adore the mochas - Iced, hot, peppermint, whatever-  it is always good.  The pomegranate citrus iced tea is so refreshing. I think I might be addicted.  Other top-notch items include muffins (blueberry and double chocolate-chip, especially), pasta bar, the Naughty Nurse and Dirty Doctor sandwich melts (and the names just make it more fun!), and the freakin' fabulous soup we had the other night... some kind of African spices?  Lentils, beef... amazing stuff.   We've also loved their burger, omelets, creme-brulee cupcake, etc.  They always have a number of gluten-free options, and they are constantly adding new ones - THANK YOU!

The imperfections (still not phasing me - because I LOVE them) - wait time for meals can be pretty long, which isn't a big deal if I'm staying and chatting, but occasionally I'm just ordering food to take home and don't have enough time to wait and wait.  Didn't love the peach-oatmeal muffin... meh.  See? Minor issues.  Nothing we can't get past, and still live happily ever after.

Been coming here since they opened and were just a small coffee shop, now they have a great variety of things to shop for while you wait for your food or drink.  The food is so good, you cant really go wrong with anything you order.  The breakfast burrito is tasty and HUGE.  The pastries are yummy too.
This place is a less chaotic version on LGO, and I like it more! They owners are so nice and down to earth, and you can always find something ninteresting in here. I love the atmosphere!

My boyfriend and I came here on a Saturday night jazz night once and I've been here a couple of times for coffee. I really want to love this place but I just can't get into it. Each time I've been I haven't been moved by the coffee drinks and the veggie lavash pizza I had for dinner was just okay. 

The ambiance is great and I love the location. I just feel it's a little overpriced and the market holds very few things I couldn't find at Trader Joe's/Sprouts for a better price.

I can definitely see the appeal. Nice & healthy. I've been meaning to try their breakfast. Perhaps that will win me over...

Cool place, my first time here. I stopped in around 2 for a late lunch figuring I would just miss the lunch crowd, the place was still packed though which is a sign of I guess how good the place is. 

The food I ordered was fresh and good, the employees were friendly and the place overall was clean. 

If it's your first time like it was for me, it takes you a moment as there is a lot going on inside lol. There is a general store type inside with healthy food items and a lot of  "stuff" like little oddities which I didn't get a chance to look around as to how busy and compact the area was. 

Parking......OMG....haha. It is freakin a nightmare, good luck with that! There is parking in the back but even that was packed when I went. It is on a busy corner and the strip mall is busy itself with very limited parking so it make take you a minute to find a spot. Just know that in advance and you'll be great .  

Overall good place, I'll be back to try their coffee another day.
Great breakfast spot. Their omelets and potatoes are awesome. Great coffee. I strongly recommend Luci's for breakfast!

The menu has everything you could possibly want for either breakfast or lunch. Pretty good crowd, not a wait though, on this holiday morning. Looks like they forgot to build a big parking lot for this grocery store also. Nothing on the shelves could not be found at either Whole Foods or Sprouts. The pastries and bagels are not made on site, therefore it's best to utilize the sandwiches or egg/pancake fresh items made to order. Great choice on my part going with the breakfast bomb (burrito). A very unusual version made with alot of very colorful potatoes, most of which are organic because there were sweet, purple, yellow and white potatoes in there. Other ingredients were only eggs of course, finely chopped hickory bacon and cheddar cheese, but not alot like in Mexican places. Also, you get your choice of three tortillas flavors and sun-dried was my choice. Great burro for $7.99 and worth it for the solid parts inside. It looks nothing like any standard Mexi burrito. They give you a nice mild salsa on the side, but you will need more if you eat the whole thing (a challenge unless your starved). Grabbed a fresh lemonade at $3.25 for a good holiday breakfast.

I wanted to like this place. I truly did. I love the concept of store and restaurant in one. The building was hot, like uncomfortable hot. I went to study and I couldn't stay long because it was so uncomfortable in there. The tables are super close together and that with the heat - little claustrophobic. The food was ok. I got the burger. I felt it was overpriced and not much flavor but the quantity of food is legit. The coffee is good and that was the bright spot. I would probably run in for a coffee from time to time, but I wouldn't stay. The staff was friendly, but I just wanted to get out of there. I wanted this to be my new spot, but sadly it's just not for me.

The food was good and the service was nice too, but somethings were a little off:
my burrito was sort of flat, not rounded, and the sour cream (which I thought they forgot to serve, along with the salsa) was actually already in the burrito. The description of the meal didn't mention any cheese, but then the staffer asked what kind of cheese I wanted. Fair enough, but my friend has the same thing happen! Her tuna sandwich came with horseradish...which the description didn't mention either....and she hates horseradish. So all in all, ok, but sort of a really sad knock off of LGO.

I love the fact that it's kitty corner from a Starbucks and still holds it's own.

I'll be honest, I have never taken an offered cooking class, bought that many items at the marketplace or hung out for the atmosphere...

...but I do partake in the coffee bar and love it. I always avoid the temptation of their amazingly wonderful looking morning eats and sweets, and I don't know how I continue to resist. 

I get my Chai Tea Latte or my sugar with coffee and cream (just like Mike D.) and head into work. I love the vintage fun feel you get and the neighborhood environment is nifty. 

I guess I need to expand and try one of their cooking classes or at least hang out and give the atmosphere a chance to sink in.

Though it doesn't have the drive through like the Starbucks I mentioned earlier, it does have a pretty fast moving coffee bar set up and barista. Even if I am running tight for work, I still take the time to park, get off my tush and walk into Luci's because it really does help brighten my day... and walking off with their cute blue and orange to go cup reminds you to smile as you walk into the office.

I was so bummed today about my breakfast. I normally love Lucy's! Always raving about it and bringing new people here. My husband and I both ordered the special: Eggs Benedict. I understand they are busy, fine and we waited. 20 minutes later with finally got one of the plates. It was cold, egg yokes were broken, and the eggs whites were super runny... Slimy! Then they brought the second plate out and the yokes were hard. If we weren't in such a crunch for time I would have asked about what was going on because this was out of the norm for them. We will be back but I wanted to let them know.

I don't get it.  Why the good reviews?  OK, the marketplace is really pretty cool, but nothing too, too special.  And the menu SOUNDS wonderful but...

After receiving great service while ordering, I waited...and waited...and waited for my three egg omelet.  I had to finally ask about it and when it arrived?  ICK!  Brown, dry omelet, and the potatoes were like hockey pucks.  Really pretty bad, I thought.

Disappointing because place definitely has atmosphere.

While this place does have an extensive menu - the wait is ridiculous.  You get a number and sit at a table waiting for your food.  This is even if you order to go.  I waited over 15 min for a breakfast sandwich  - which still came out wrong.  The sandwiches on the lunch menu sound so enticing that I decided to try it again.  I called in an order this time and went to pick it up 5 min later than they said - still not ready.  The prices are way higher than anywhere else around there and it is honestly not worth it.

11/3/2016 
Yelp review
Luci's Healthy Marketplace
1590 E. Bethany Home Rd. Phoenix, Arizona 85014¬∑ ~9.8 mi (602)-773-1339

I have lived in Arizona for all my existence and I have not found a breakfast joint I have loved, until I stumbled upon Luci's Healthy Market Place. I may be bias but they have the best pancakes I have even had. Growing up my parents always took me to IHop and Denny's but I always felt like I wasn't doing my body any good. Most breakfast joints only have dishes that are super unhealthy and too sweet to be consumed in the morning. Luci's is an amazing place to lay back and relax. My go to dish is the "Big Boy Breakfast" it's amazing and I recommended it to any "first timers". It doesn't take too artificial or over processed and you feel satisfied afterwards. Breakfast is the most important meal of the day and Luci's is the place to start the day.

When you first walk into Luci's, one might be overwhelmed because there is an actual market within the restaurant. The market has many organic goods that are unique and you wouldn't be able to find at any Wal-Mart. When I go, I always find myself looking at the knick-knacks that are so cute and tempting to buy. The aesthetic of Luci's is very sweet. It has a very retro vibe yet very rustic. The actual restaurant is very small, sometimes I must admit, it gets really tight and overwhelming. You wait in line to order and wait for the server to serve your food. The wait is very short, even when there is many people ordering food. It's kid friendly and accommodating for many people in a hurry. 


One time, my mom and I ordered a Green Tea smoothie and as we stepped outside to enjoy the day, I, of course, dropped my smoothie and go it all over my shoes and the pavement. I went in side to get some napkins to clean my shoes. I wasn't going to ask for a new drink because I was too embarrassed, but a server saw what happened from a far and ordered me a drink without even asking. Once I was done cleaning myself up, I saw a server coming towards me with a new Green tea smoothie. When she handed it to me, I was so happy and grateful. I tried to tip her, but she didn't let me. I expressed my gratitude, and left. With that being said, the service at Luci's is amazing! They always go the extra mile and they really made my day a whole lot better. Service really makes a difference and I recommend this place to anyone and everyone. 



The server, Amanda, that replaced my drink was amazing and I always look for her whenever I visit Luci's. When I think of making good eating habits, I think of Luci's. Their potions aren't outrages and are satisfying. This local joint is very popular in my part of town and you can always expect an amazing time when you go. I give Luci's Healthy Market Place, 5 out of 5 stars for amazing everything! Please try this place, its amazing and healthy! Replace IHop with Luci's and it will change your life!

Maybe I ordered the wrong thing, but my breakfast sandwich was pretty terrible. I'd rather eat a sausage mcmuffin with egg from mcdonalds. I sampled some other food from my friends and they were slightly better but nothing to write home about. The atmosphere of the place was nice though.
Adorable spot. Great salads and sandwiches. Hard to park.  Cute shop items inside too.

I don't like that they have two counters and still force a to go order to walk up to the main counter and wait in the line for their order. Then what the hell do they have the second counter for then?! To go orders are a pain here and completely unpredictable since you walk in and sometimes there's a person at the second counter taking your to go order and sometimes you need to wait in the main line for the order. It is not efficient and the food is so so, and not worth the pain in the ass to order and lines can get long during rushes. They also do not provide any condiments for to go orders such as ketchup, hot sauce, Tabasco, nothing! Unless you ask for it... The food is ok here but if you are ordering to go I would not suggest coming here until they provide a more time efficient way to get your food.
Simple food, great ambiance, a inexpensive menu. We had the Greek omelet, it just needed more feta & I would have gave them 4 stars.
Great food, friendly staff very unique place with a great energy.  Love the specials they have daily and they have great coffee.  This is a must try spot for breakfast

Quality food in a relaxing atmosphere would best describe Luci's. 
I ordered the grass fed burger with a side salad. 
The burger was cooked to a perfect medium and it was super juicy. The saut√©ed mushrooms and bacon finished the burger perfectly. If you are a bread freak you will fall in love with the challah bun. 
The side salad was a nice combo of greens, fresh cherry tomatoes and artichoke hearts. 
When you are done eating they have a fun market section that is worth browsing thru.

Love this! Heathy options and a great place to grab a quick lunch with a friend or to get some work done! The food is delicious. Especially the bacon. Whatever you do- order something with bacon on it! It's so good.

Been here before. Just ate next door and stopped by here to get a drink. Grabbed a sweet green tee and a slice of classic cheesecake. Menu is great as well as the grab and go options. Highly recommended. Breakfast here is amazing. French toast is my favorite item.

Oh Luci's... what am I going to do with you?

On one hand, I love you. You've got very nice staff, good service and a great atmosphere. (I especially like the art-deco bathrooms) but your coffee is just meh. Maybe your other products are great but the iced coffee always tastes bland. I see you every time I come out of work and I know Starbucks is across the street, I just would really like some less bitter, more coffee-tasting coffee.

I REALLY want to like you because I'd rather give my money to you instead of Starbucks (nothing against Starbucks, I just want to help the littler guy as much as possible.) 

I haven't had anything else on the menu really, I just stop in for coffee, maybe it's fantastic, who knows?

What a wonderful cool little place!

I had a roast beef and horseradish sandwich with the best potato salad I have ever tasted!!! I lived most of my life in Austin Tx  and the south prides themselves on their potato salad! Luci's if by far the best!
Our real estate agent took us there and I'm still thanking her for a wonderful lunch!

 I currently Live in Albuquerque and just ate close to the same sandwich here at Flying star it was repulsive. 

Luci's is wonderful and you wont be disappointed!

update; their food effing sucks... so far i've tried the chicken salad with pita bread and the grilled chicken salad, both were pre-made sitting in a cooler... the chicken salad had about as much flavor as my vitamins i take everyday and the grilled chicken on my salad was tough and unpleasant... i will not get another 9 dollar peice of crap meal here ever again.

This is a great place to eat! The food here has never disappointed. I had stopped here for lunch a few times, but today I went for breakfast, and I was totally impressed with my food. I had the French Toast- it was great! You can't go wrong with any of the food or coffee here. This place is somewhat like La Grande Orange- but without the huge, swarming crowds.

Delicious find!! Not from this area, and really took the exit for Starbucks, missed the turn and found this place on the opposite corner!

Thank goodness, because I'll make this a regular stop when on this side of town from now on!

Yes, it's really that delicious!

Listen, the coffee is great. That's a no-brainer.  And, looking to support local business, I decided to switch up my morning routine from the always packed, never enough parking and long line drive-thru, Starbucks across the street. 

That said, I stopped into Luci's quite a few times the past month for my morning fuel (not just as a weekend treat) only to find no waiting. Good start but perhaps a little telling now that I have tested my hypothesis of coffee stops.  

I don't mind a little conversation while ordering but to repeat my order three times....I am wondering if I am speaking Italian and don't realize it.  Don't get me wrong, the baristas are friendly but I don't need to be made aware of every detail that the night crew didn't clean up or prep for the morning or that it's "a little too early to be up and moving" at 7:15am. Is that not the shift for those of you that make up part of our morning routine when I am more than willing to fork over $4.97 for a large iced coffee with some sugar free vanilla syrup? Just sayin'. 

I love the store, concept and the coffee...but for just an OK experience, I might go back to making my coffee at home and putting that money in my vacation fund.

Why have I not been coming here for years?

I always went to the Starbucks across the street for coffee and treats, but never will I go there again if I can help it.

Luci's Healthy Marketplace has the best breakfast! It's REAL food. I had their caramel latte and that was good too.

I was glad to see that on a Saturday morning, it was packed. I like the boost that it gives to the local economy. 

I've spoken with Luci before, she's a really nice lady. I'm sure I'll be a repeat customer!

Great post hike breakfast spot. The Greek Omelet is amazing. Well, as amazing as an omelet can be, I guess. It's, like, not a breakfast burrito or anything. Still though, it's something good enough to get excited about.  

Oh, what's that? You don't get excited AF about food? Then go eat at a Good Egg and stop pretending. You're basic. 

Also, can someone please tell me why I always have to order iced coffee AND iced tea? Like seriously, Morgan, it's one or the other. I don't even think caffeine works on me anymore. I just double fist my way through every morning (and every night).

(I kid.)     

(Ha ha.)

(God, I'm hilarious.)

(At least to my mom.)

Upon first pulling up to and entering Luci's there does not seem to be much to like about this place, let alone to get excited about.  However, I decided to give it a try for lunch one day.  What can I say?  I LOVE THIS PLACE! Granted there is absolutely nothing special about the atmosphere and the patrons were not quite as eclectic as I thought they would be (OK I used to hang out in Greenwich Village a lot when I lived in NY).  But the "something special" is right where it counts... The wonderful food and friendly staff.

If you are looking for unbelievably great tasting, organic, fresh and healthy food; this is the place to go.

My first time there I had the Humm-Dinger Vegan Wrap. This wrap had artichokes, zucchini, red bell peppers (all roasted to perfection), fresh and I mean FRESH spinach along with hummus and balsamic. For my side I had the homemade asiago penne salad and an herbal iced tea to drink.  The wrap was by far the best tasting wrap I have ever had anywhere! The penne salad was very good and it was a nice small portion (just the right size).  The herbal iced tea was absolutely full of flavor and the portion size on the wrap was great. If I were hungrier I could have consumed the whole wrap, but as it were I took half of it home and enjoyed it just as much the next day.

Yes, I really do love this place.  I have now been back for a third time and I have never been disappointed. The other dishes I have tried are: The Portobello "Shroom" Burger (absolutely fantastic!) and the Low Carb Gobbler Wrap (again another fresh and delicious choice).

I now look forward to going here much more often for lunch and I want to try their breakfast too.  Something tells me I won't be disappointed.

I popped in here for a yummy breakfast with a sweet friend before visiting the Farmer's Market this past Saturday. We loved our experience! First, you walk in to their adorable marketplace with so much to look at. If you're in need of a unique gift, come to Luci's, they're sure to have something that will catch your eye!

For breakfast, I ordered their Acai Bowl and my friend and I split a gluten free bagel. You guys, the bagel was DELICIOUS! Not all gluten free bagels are the bees knees but this one WAS. I also had an iced latte! The Acai bowl could have been a little colder and not as runny. It also didn't have much to it for over $10. Just the Acai mixture, bananas, blueberries, and some granola. Pretty basic. It wasn't the best one that i've ever had. I also love that they're dog-friendly! I'll definitely think about bringing my furbaby in the future! It is kind of pricey for breakfast. For my pretty simple breakfast it was $20 which seemed a little high. Anywho, I love the ambiance - good vibes all around - so we'll be back!

This place has been on my list to check out. I like the setting. A find. 
Rare healthy food options. Fresh, tasty and a different environment.
Good for friends, families or just on your own.

Plus there are nice lil' stores to check out nearby.
Nice staff. Good coffee. Casual atmosphere. Noisy, with ppl shopping, visting. Very airy and open. Real enjoyed it.

What a cute place!  I love the options in the market and on the menu.
While my breakfast sandwich was just mediocre (blame it on the bland english muffin and the sandwich having cooled off between being cooked and being served), I still this place is great and I look forward to trying other menu items.
I'll definitely return.

I want to love Luci's.  I want Luci's to be my favorite place in the hood...but I am just not cool enough to hang out there.

I've been in many times - whether for a coffee and dessert after dinner at Golden Phoenix, a quick coffee to go, or to peruse and purchase some yummies for home.

When Ken and Luci are there, the staff is amazing.  When they're not on site (or at least out front) - it's pulling teeth to get the baristas to make a drink.  Last visit, there were THREE people behind the coffee counter, ZERO people on line ahead of me...and I still had to wait for someone to offer to make me something.  And that was to order a drink and pay for over $50 worth of groceries!  I'd think with that much merchandise on the counter by the register, a smile and hello wouldn't be too much to ask.

I may up the stars after one of the cooking classes (if I ever get a Sunday eveing off work!).  And when Ken and/or Luci are there, I'd give the place 4 stars.

I admire what they brought to the area, and adore the concept, layout and selection.  If only the staff were more enthusiastic and customer service oriented.  Maybe I just don't look rich enough, or hipster enough or young enough to be worthy of their time...but I promise, my money spends just as well.
My favorite neighborhood coffee shop. The staff is very courteous and polite and everything is always done right

I love Lucis. Their green tea smoothies are delicious and their burrito bomb is the best breakfast burrito in Phoenix (in my opinion, of course). The only problem is it's pretty pricey so my trips there are reserved to when I'm feeling a little wealthy, but I still can appreciate a good breakfast place, no matter the price.

Decent food. I had the Greek omelette. The other diner have the sunrise with a side order of a bagel and cream cheese but did not arrive till we asked for it a third time at the end of the meal.

Very long and somewhat confusing ordering system. Sales prevention on additional items since you'd have to go all the way back to the other side of the place and get back in line. Thus I did not get one of their wonderful looking cinnamon rolls, but found it easier to get into my car and drive to sprouts for a piece a cake.

Luci's is a great little neighborhood spot. They have a coffee bar that offers great lattes and teas, etc... The staff is awesome, not sure why some reviewers seem to think otherwise. They are friendly, remember your name and always show a sense of urgency. The parking is pretty tight, so you might have to circle around the back of the shopping center once or twice. The menu offers some great sandwiches and salads, as well as some special diet options. They have some gluten-free items on the main menu and I believe they have the same in dessert/pastry items. One of my favorite things is breakfast and it's offered all-day at Luci's! The marketplace portion itself is pretty cool, not huge, but has a decent amount of shelf space to hold products usually found at Whole Foods. Lots of seating room and they have a big rolling garage-style door that opens the cafe area to the outside. It's especially nice in the spring and fall times. Beer and wine are also available in their coolers and they have dairy items as well. They also sell random funny things all over the place. Sarcastic magnets and notepads, etc... Check this place out, it's definitely worth a shot!

Tip: For quicker service, call in your order ahead of time!
Awesome local products and produce. My new favorite grocery store!

Lucy's market has delicious food as well as little mic knacks you can't find anywhere else. The staff is always friendly and the prices are reasonable. If you like cool caf√©s and are interested in a healthy life style then this spot will be a hit for you! Enjoy

Luci's...you know - it was pretty good, and had a lot of cool stuff (in addition to food and drink), but I'm just not their demographic.  It was mostly younger ladies (under 40) and hipster dudes.  

Solid place, but not my vibe.

For me, Luci's really hasn't lived up to the hype. I've tried their burger (meh..) and a couple of their sandwiches. The breakfast burrito has been the best thing I've tried so far and it was super good on the sun-dried tomato wrap. 

Overall, the atmosphere is awesome but the food is just okay for the price.

What keeps me coming back is the stellar service, the delicious green tea and yummy 'Hot Juan Black Bean Burger' that automatically comes with avocado (YIPPEE!). My only complaint is that with as busy as they are it's hard to find a spot to park or if you want to bring your laptop and work the tables are typically full. None the less, I always leave this place with a smile.

Really great atmosphere. And a good place to hangout with friends or by yourself. The people at the coffee bar are AWESOME! But as far as the food. It's disgusting. They hide behind the word "healthy". The eggs come out of a box and the portion sizes are too big. There is nothing "healthy" about Luci's.
Amazing. Service was fantastic and the food was delicious. Adorable store. The entire family enjoyed this venue.

Best coffee in town! This little jewel has been in our neighborhood for a while now and has become a local hangout. Great service! The team makes a point of knowing your name which is genuinely nice when your greeted coming through the door. 

The menu is eclectic and not short on flavor. But the coffee...it's great. 

If you don't know the story behind Luci's take minute and read about it...it'll bless your soul.

Great food and service. Everyone is always nice. Brandon the barista who works in the mornings during the week really makes the place. He is always super nice and and remembers a lot of the regulars names.

Luci's is a totally cool new space and idea in the shopping plaza on the NWC of Bethany Home & 16th Street. I'm really happy with what they have done with the place and they have a great idea going. Only problem is that they might need to expand with it. I walked in expecting more of a small grocer/cafe but found it to be mostly a nutritional supplement store with slim pickins. The prepared foods section is scary tiny, with only one vegetarian option. The grocery section is tiny and reminds me of some sort of mash up between Sprouts/Healthy Habit/Cost Plus. Overall an interesting place and idea but needs to improve the selection/variety of specialty grocery goods and pre-prepared foods.

When I had time to spare or happen to miss my turn on my way to work I LOVE to splurge and visit Luci's for their absolutely amazing coffee. 

I've been here a few times and always forget that I want to shop for random gifts when I'm there! So FYI not only is their coffee to die for, you'll want to buy all of your girlfriends gifts while you're there! 

The only thing, if you're a weirdo like me, is depending on the temperature you prefer your coffee you may need to order extra hot. The normal temp they seem make their drinks at is more on my definition of warm when I prefer hot.

Cheers and I can't wait to visit wiry enough time to order food!

Had a perfect lox bagel. Had the universal bagel I guess and it was super aromatic and it had good amount (a lot) of cream cheese. And plenty of lox and capers, and blue onion! 
The place is also lovely as it has open windows and it feels like a terrace! I could only wish real cups for the coffee! :)

I used to really like Luci's for its fresh food, good service, and the fun vibe of the Sunbrite plaza it's in. The two last visits were disappointing -- long, slow lines, barely anywhere to sit, and the food was just okay. My breakfast "sammie" was cold but had a nice flavor from the bacon. It comes with no sides. I overheard a manager explaining to a patron the somewhat complicated ordering system as "fast casual." I'm not sure about the fast part - if by "casual" we mean "disorganized" then I'll vouch for that. They deliver your food to you but you have to get your beverage yourself. After I stood around in the crowded area around the coffee bar for ten minutes and got my latt√©, I returned to my seat to find someone else in it, even though my plate had been dropped off. I relocated to the chef bar by the kitchen to eat my lukewarm sandwich in peace -- only to be bugged by a family asking to have my seat since everything else was occupied. I would have liked to get a water, but there was no one to ask and I didn't feel like going back in the long line. It's just too much money for the hassle and miserable experience. It's also unfortunate that all the fun little shops that used to give the plaza its character are gone. It could be any blas√© strip mall in Phoenix now. I'll look elsewhere.

I've been coming to Luci's for well over five years. The food is always high quality, the staff is attentive friendly and outgoing. While the grocery selection is small, if you're in a pinch whatever they have in stock always works for me.

Luci's is a comfort food stop with a huge dose of healthy. Yesterday I had a turkey wrap; it had a healthy serving of romaine with the substantial turkey and bacon. The dressing was awesome in this wrap too - I'm guessing it was a homemade Green Goddess. 

Service is always friendly. (Amazingly, the server responded immediately when they served it as a sandwich. No blame game but let us redo as a wrap for you!)

I've also tried the burgers & fries here. The dish makes me want to redo/ copy the 5 Guys DAMN YouTube. DAMN.

A detour to this corner requires planning and patience to park, and perhaps walk a bit. However, those two steps lead to a nice reward.

I'm a big fan of their moment of zen smoothie drink. But they also have incredible brunch. They have a new special (as far as I know) every Saturday. They even make a real sample to display on the counter. The portions are small but definitely filling. Also they have an Acai bowl which is pretty hard to find in Phoenix. 

The place also doubles up as a small market that has some unique offerings. If they're not busy you can easily peruse their store before grabbing a seat for your meal.

Parking sucks, food is good but please GET SOME PERSONNEL TO CLEAN TABLES, every time we go there's available tables but with trash on them,u ask someone to clean it off and there so busy they say ok and never come back, after the second time u ask again it's like a bother and go with attitude to clean it, (that's your job hello) anyways there food is delicious just need to work on keeping the restaurant clean

I stopped in for coffee and noticed the "molasses and ginger" cookies. I asked the order taker person if that was like gingerbread. She said,  "No, it's like ginger and molasses. " Ok. No tip. Did not buy the cookie, and I'll NEVER go back.

Came here this weekend after a hike with our pup.  The side of the building was open and we were able to sit at a table without any problem.

They offer $3 mimosas (at least on the weekend, I am trying to recall) with fresh orange juice.  Those were amazing!  

We had the krabby pants omelette and it was pretty good, but I don't think it quite lived up to the price.  

Also, prepared for everything to be crowded, you may not mind that at all.  I always find it a little weird to have to stalk people who are almost done eating to grab their tables, it makes for some awkward eye contact.  

I would highly recommend for a nice place to unwind and enjoy yourself with company!

I'm giving you five stars because I love you. And I truly think you deserve it. 

But it's early. I'm tired. I just ordered a coffee and two of my four modifiers were wrong. ICED? Check. BLACK? Check. LARGE? What the hell is this puny little bastard? FRENCH VANILLA? There were no pumps of anything in there. 

Your coffee is the best. At least to me. But when I'm thinking about waking up and getting it the night before and the morning comes and I'm totally disappointed, it's such a challenge to pull myself from this mood. 

Did you hear that Starbucks just implemented a rule that the baristas can't make more than two drinks at once? It's because we're only human and we fuck shit up. Sure, there was a line, but it wasn't out the door. Just relax and listen to the order. Repeat it back. Only work on, at max, two things at once. 

I would have just said something but I knew I would be rude and I didn't want to be mean so I just kept my mouth shut. 

Anyway, I read some of your others reviews and I don't think a lot of people are being fair. For the space, I think your choices for healthy foods are inspired. They are the right combination of appeal to the masses and appeal to the hippies. 

All I want is a really big coffee. 32 fluid ounces. Please. It's important that it's right. If I want a shitty, expensive drink I can go across the street to *$.

Been there twice-once for breakfast and the other time for a coffee and gluten-free treat. Both experiences were wonderful! I recommend the Crabby Pant omelette and gluten free flapjacks! Nice vibe and great open indoor/outdoor patio. Nice selection of snacks and love the organic coffee! Parking is challenging if busy!

I tried to be optimistic but just couldn't love really anything about the place. Maybe the pretty color scheme? 

Coffee was just okay. There was nothing special that I couldn't get elsewhere. We went there for brunch and since the breakfast menu offered such an average selection, we ordered a sandwich instead. I don't recommend the Po Boy sandwich, which took over 20 minutes to make and tasted like s***. Sorry, but this is the reason why Phoenix is always missing something that urban cities have . . . character, taste, and uniqueness. 

Don't get me wrong, we need more healthy food markets that are independently owned but Luci's standard for food and selection of what they sell is an extreme disappointment and even an embarrassment.

I drive by Luci's so much and I finally got to try it last week. I wish I had popped into here sooner! Luci's is all things fresh with a tad of 'just in case' .. that would be the beer and wine in the cooler that they offer, or all the cool gifts, gadgets and even chocolates and candy to browse or buy in the marketplace that is sort of housed around the seating. The concept is simple. You order at the counter, grab your table with your number and they deliver your order a short while later. Luci's is hipster and cool and such a great place for a simple coffee or tea; freshly blended juice or smoothie;  a salad, sandwich, breakfast or like I said above, a  grab and sit beer or wine. The day that I was in, with my hiking mate, I somehow managed to beat the maniac lunch rush and got a high top table at the window. I ordered the ever fresh made to order, " Chop Chop Cobb Salad, a light mix of spinach and seasonal squash, diced tomato, roasted turkey, applewood smoked bacon, red onion and marinated artichoke hearts. All topped with a home made bleu cheese pesto dressing. My daughter, ordered the Tuna Nicosia Salad. This salad was also fresh and yummy. It was made with fresh albacore tuna salad and served over mixed greens, with cucumber, tomato, a few green beans, a little hardboiled egg, red potato, red onion and olives and finished off with a light citrusy vinaigrette. Both of our salads were super filling and good! My salad was so loaded with bacon, I pulled some of it off! Luci's offers gluten free items on the menu, as well as ordering online, in case you are in a rush.. order before you go! I also noticed that Luci's serves breakfast all day and has a different special every day! Parking can be a mess here.. I will give that to where its located! So planning to dine here will take just that... some planning to beat the rush of morning or lunch. But albeit that, the service is happy, great and with a smile! The food is fresh, healthy and lovely. Since the food is so healthy, you can splurge on that other stuff!

I truly admire Luci's concept. They carry a lot of unique products on their shelves. The staff is kind and welcoming. It's overall a bright, welcoming space for people to gather.

Unfortunately, I am consistently underwhelmed by what they serve. The hot coffee and cold brew tastes like a standard diner cup of coffee, which is perfectly palatable, but nothing to look forward to. Their breakfast food is satisfactory, but leaves very little to be memorable. Additionally, on multiple occasions there have been pieces of meat in their medley potatoes. As a self-proclaimed healthy marketplace, I would expect their cooks to be more aware of cross contamination of ingredients, especially since they accommodate many vegetarians and vegans.

Ultimately, come here for what they stand for, but not necessarily to be blown away.

Again, the haters grumble about trivial issues...

I walked to Luci's from my house and was parched when I arrived.  I grabbed a large cup of the BEST TEA OF MY LIFE.  It's a pomegranate citrus green tea and they sell it for 5.99 in the tea area.. Usually green teas are bitter or have a bitter bite, but this tea was excellent. I had 3 huge glasses.. By the time I got home I had to pee in the worst way.. hah!

OK, second thing. Ken the owner  was walking around talking to everyone and told us about the work they did to install new trusses in the building .. way cool.

As you walk in (facing the coffee station), check out the food in the fridge.. it's prepared fresh every morning and the intent is for people to grab on the way to work.. fresh home made food.. awesome.. 

We also met Ebenezer Williams, the chef responsible for the hominy and beet chicken salad we had.. man was that good.  We talked to Ebenezer for a while about his cooking and he said the reason he cooks is to see that look in peoples eyes when they taste something really great that they didn't expect.. well Ebenezer, zing; Hominy and Beets it is!

REALLY Cool Fact: they have a demo kitchen where they'll be doing cooking classes and other food related stuff.. right on! 

The only thing I'd like to see in addition to the cool stuff they're already doing is a weekend special like Omelet  Sundays or pancake Saturdays.. that would rock!

Great breakfast burrito bomb, great turkey omelet, bottomless coffee, $3 wine/sangria/mimosas all day, and yummy pastries! Don't forget to join the loyalty program...it's nice getting $5 off now and again.

I met a coworker here for lunch and forgot how much I really enjoy this place.  I love the laid back vibe, amazing menu of fresh food, friendly staff and fun gifts to choose from.  This time I enjoyed the turkey burger with no bun and loved it - so flavorful and tasty.  The only negative is the lack of parking...make sure to get there early to secure a spot!

LOVE Lucy's!! The  atmosphere is so relaxing, staff is so upbeat, happy, nice and welcoming! The food is AMAZING to say the least. I love going and just sitting down and enjoying a meal there no one every bothers me! Great place to bring a book and just read! The chop chop cobb salad is the best fyi!

Great local place that offers coffee, tea, sandwiches, bagels, fresh local ingredients and that small business coffee shop vibe. They also have a marketplace offering health food, organics, wine, local items and kitschy items. Come in a few times and they'll remember your name and drink. The baristas are friendly and FAST. In the rush hours it can be jammed full but you can still grab your coffee, breakfast sandwich, and a fresh salad for lunch in under ten minutes. A fun place to hang out for lunch or breakfast. 

They are pricier than Circle K (obviously) but less than Starbucks with a much more pleasant environment. The parking is minimal directly in front of the shop so it can be a tight squeeze during heavy business hours.

Luci's tends to be my go-to place to when I have some take-home work or need a place to study.  They have free wi-fi and an atmosphere conducive to work, study, or even have a leisurely read.    

They have good coffee, great iced tea, and delicious pastries.  I am partial to the scones and brownies.  I have only ordered the turkey burger off the menu.  It has a Mediterranean flair, was garnished with red peppers and artichoke hearts, and complimented with a side of regular and sweet potato tater tots.  It was an excellent sandwich, especially when compared to many of the outstanding restaurants in the area. 

The service is what makes Luci's shine.  The staff is friendly and attentive.  A manager usually asks about your food and won't hesitate to refill your iced tea.  Notwithstanding, I did have one negative experience with the service.  They forgot to make a coffee that I ordered.  After complaining, they apologized, quickly made my drink, and even gave me a $5,00 gift card for the inconvenience.  To their credit, they went above and beyond, which is more than what most places would do.

Luci's also has a market attached to the restaurant/coffee shop.  They have a small but quality selection of wines, beers, cheeses, prepared foods, and a variety of other items.  

Luci's is a great place to study/work, grab a quick bite, or have a casual date.  You should definitely check it out if you're in the area.

This is the best sandwich place in the valley by far. It has so many options to choose from, and is very veg. friendly. The market has many items that are hard to find in a regular grocery store. Also, try them lemonade. It is to die for!
Love luci's! Everything is yummy! Love that I can get a salad in the grab and go:) breakfast is also good. Killer pancakes:)

I love the food I get delivered from here. I use UberEats to deliver to my home and work. Yesterday, I ordered enough food to last me an entire weekend and the food tasted just as good the next day as it did the first. I have yet to visit this restaurant and dine in, but one day I will. I would recommend this place to anyone who likes tasty healthy food.

A place like Luci's is definitely needed in this location. I like their selection of products they have for sale (Weleda, Seventh generation, beer, cold drinks,  ice cream, etc) just anything I would usually get from Whole Foods or Sprouts, just without the drive. The store has a good feel to it. So why 3 stars? The pastries... I wonder why they didn't change the supplier in a long time. Today was the last time I gave them a try. No more. Coffee.... It  takes them too long to make a cup. If I am in hurry I just go across the street to Starbucks. I will not practice the virtue of patience, while waiting for my coffee, only to be nice.

Gourmet pickles and breakfast. Two tings I don't have rarely but I found both here.

I had a basic veggie omelet with potatoes and some fruit. Even as a split plate is was a good size and made for an affordable $4.50 each ($9ish total)

The eggs were as expected, I was surprised by the meddely of potatoes including purple ones, it was good and unusual. The fruit was nothing too special. What made the meal great was a decent selection of small label hot sauces.

In the market they had some nice gourmet pickles, something I had been looking for some time. 

My one complaint is that the meals and other things seem to be about 20% higher priced then I would like to see.

I just learned the meaning "I've died and gone to haven" after having the daily Luci's breakfast at 2:30pm:) the amount of vegetables they put in the omelet were amazing as well as the fresh taste of the ingredients. I've struggled with finding a breakfast place that uses fresh Ingredients and actually puts a good amount of vegetables as advertised! I just can't believe  I haven't tried this place before but rest a sure I have found my new breakfast joint

Love the funny merchandise!! But I ordered a coffee and people were all served but me. So I'm waiting finally the cashier ask if I need anything. ( uhmm yes I just gave you money for an americano ) she acted like it was the end of the world to make my espresso and water with ice. Rude!

An excerpt from a letter to Slade Grove, Wicked Kitchen Confections:

"Luci's was the perfect spot to feature your confections. The service was amazing. My latte had a little heart in foam on the top. The service people were so friendly, but I feel like they should know more about what a big deal you are :) I had to educate them! I could put together a powerpoint if you'd like (kidding).
The place was neat and tidy but had a nice warm quality to it. They had the convertible doors open so the breeze was really fitting for a late morning pastry-brunch."

A friend and I skipped the gym and went over to Luci's to celebrate my birthday and the Wicked pastries now being featured. We split a cinnamon roll and a red velvelt mini-cake (because according to Slade cupcake are out of fashion). The atmosphere was clean but cozy, the coffee was delicious and served with a smile. As far as the pastries... it's Slade. You can't go wrong.
Luci, the owner, was outgoing and interested in our opinions of the place.
Overall, it was a lovely experience. I hope to return soon for an actual meal or maybe to take a cooking lesson.

Really enjoy Luci's.  Had the Spaniard Omelette which was good. The chicken chorizo, which you don't see very often, was really nice.  Could have had just a little more spice/bite to it but was good nonetheless.  My friend Burrito Bomb which is her usually and which she lives.  Coffee refills are free which is really nice.  Great vibe and ambience. Perfect place for a Sunday morning.

Been coming to this place 6+ years now and love the friendly service and consistently delicious food. Sandwiches, pasta salad, lavosh, and desserts are all wonderful. Atmosphere is upbeat yet warm and cozy. Also offers lots of unique and fun gifts as well as some interesting grocery items. Parking can be a bear when it's busy.

There is so much I could say about this place, and there would still be so much left to say. I really love it. Great service, great atmosphere, and a great selection of food and groceries. 

They have a huge menu and serve breakfast all day long, and a decent drink list. I get the Chai tea latte, and its delicious. They also have fresh pastries to go along with your meal or drink. 

It's local places like this that gives a community its own flavor. It's certainly a spot that I have come to love hanging out and getting a bit to eat or picking up a treat before heading home. Give it a try.

Let me start by saying, that Luci's is a welcome edition to the neighborhood.  It's so nice to drive down the street and see the big glass garage doors open, with people drinking coffee in the morning, and enjoying  live music in the evenings. Their staff is great, and the owners seem very kind as well.

I gotta say that I haven't tried anything freshly made at Luci's that blew me away, EXCEPT the blueberry sour cream muffin.  Holy Cow, it's delicious!  Luci's also has descent coffee, which I will always choose over the Starbucks across the street. I'm slightly addicted to their bottomless helpings of iced pomegranate green tea, which is a proprietary blend just for them.

Luci's is a great alternative to the somewhat shady liquor stores and aging Basha's along 16th street to get a nice bottle of wine and/or an interesting microbrew.  You can also purchase a single beer, if you just need a single cold one after a long day.

I give it 3 stars b/c the "healthy marketplace" offerings are uninspired and overpriced. As I mentioned I haven't had anything there that knocks my socks off.  I just think that the standards need to be higher with respect to simple food that awakens your taste buds.  There's a lot of potential there, and I just want them to go for it!

A friend has recommended this place. I had breakfast, buckwheat pancakes with blueberry and turkey chorizo. The pancakes tasted like whatever meat was cooked on the gridle prior to my pancakes. I had to drown the taste with syrup. Then, the turkey chorizo was ground white turkey meat, which was good, but it was seasoned with what tasted like taco seasoning. I could have saved $18 and cooked my own breakfast at home.

I am smiling as I walk in and walk out , so you know this has got to be a good place.   The vibe as my oldest and I walk in is "good morning ", lots of happy Barristas  serving up  big globs of happy. We were hungry and not quite awake but quickly after eyeing the menu and the sunshine vibe , we got our happy on and we too were ready for the day. Love the bright retro  mood as you walk in complete with Upbeat old school music 
( Abba, Issac Hayes and the theme from Happy Days, I am not joking ) 
I had a tall cooling caffeine laden glass of pomegranate, green tea that made me smile, along with a nice made to order pile of eggs and fruit . The taste was filling and just what I wanted ..that's I went with the made to order eggs.    Jessica had the egg burrito that looked so big I was afraid for her. It was tasty and actually way too much food.  Mmmmmmyummmy.    
Clean , Neat well organized, and a little health food mini mart to boot. Wish  I lived close enough to make this place my go to local market...
I will be back with Mom in tow ..and next time I am getting a wicked pastry ....thanks Luci.

Expensive! Worth every penny though. This place makes high quality, healthy food for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. The staff are always high energy, smiling and very helpful which helps make the atmosphere extremely positive and inviting. This place i

On my way to lunch in the same plaza, I spotted Luci's - a place I'd been hearing about lately.  I decided I would stop in after lunch, and did just that.

What a cute place!  I love the decor and love that there seem to be lots of treasures to be found in the market area.  Since I didn't do more than take a cursory glance as I walked in, this review will be for the coffeeshop/bakery only.

First... the good.

1. The two women behind the counter were both very friendly and helpful, which counts for a lot at any place I visit.

2. The display case of baked good was stocked with lots of really beautiful pastries.  I found myself wanting a small bite of everything!

3. Even though it wasn't on the menu, I was able to order a cafe au lait - my current obsession.

4. Seating was plentiful and comfortable.

And the not-so-good...

1. The strawberry cupcake, while beautiful and dusted with really pretty edible shimmer of some sort, was dry, crumbly, and not very good.  The icing tasted great but left a very strange film in my mouth - sort of waxy, oily, greasy consistency.

2. I've been advised that it is not out of the norm for a coffeeshop to hand you your cup of heated milk/foam/etc. for you to fill on your own with coffee from carafes (not so with espresso-based drinks), but I'm really bothered by this practice for some reason.  Luci's is the second place in Phoenix I've visited who does this.  Maybe I'm just being fussy about it, but I think if I'm going to pay $4 for some steamed milk and coffee, the least you can do is top it off with coffee for me.

3. When I'm paying $4 to pour my own coffee, I expect the last 1/4 of the cup will not be filled with coffee grounds.  This happened to me today (not until I got back to the office, of course) and I was very displeased about it.

Luci's is a nice little place, the employees are very friendly, and the coffee (sans grounds) was actually pretty good.  I can see it being a nice place to read, people-watch, or even do some work, so it does have a lot going for it.  I'm not sure I'll ever go out of my way to visit, but if I'm in the area and it comes down to choosing Luci's over Starbucks (which is just across the street), Luci's will win any day.

Its one of the cutest places in town.  Buy some groceries (the location is convenient and selection is small, but interesting, pricing is normal for a boutique grocery). 

I had a muffin there once that was decent.  I sometimes will stop and get two pieces of cake to go.  

I ate food there twice, once was when they first opened, so I'll not write about that, as I'm sure they were working out hiccups. the second time was breakfast.  I just had that muffin, but my boyfriend had a breakfast burrito. the potatoes were undercooked and it was just a mass of scrambled eggs with little flavor.  he won't eat there again, so it'll be a while before I try to eat there again. 

I hope the quality of the food improves, as I really like having cool places to eat near the house. I gave them an extra star for being in my hood.

I got the build your own omelet with all the  veggies and a side of potatoes. It was delicious! There were tons of veggies and everything tastes very fresh. I got an Americano with cream that was pretty good. Not as good as fame or lux but better than Starbucks. I liked that it was counter service because it felt more casual. This place can get very busy though and it can be hard to find a table. I would suggest going earlier in the morning or on a weekday. We ended up getting a table but felt a bit crowded. I love that this place has specialty groceries too. They have tons of cute knick knacks and everything you could need for your gluten free, paleo, non gmo, baking needs. Overall, super cute place with delicious food!

I LOVE LUCI'S!!!!!!!!!!! I stop here every morning for coffee and the occasional breakfast to go. The staff is amazing and friendly and the food is healthy and delicious. Now there is a 2nd location and I hope to see a chain in the future!!!!

This super cute little restaurant/shop has great food and friendly service in a casual atmosphere. It's a favorite, especially after hiking Squaw Peak. 

We've been here many, many times for breakfast - the pastries are yummy, the food is interesting and well-executed (the chef's special is always excellent), and the shop is fun to browse (a little spendy for actual buying, but great novelty items). 

The pancakes are yummy, the crabby pants omelet is fabulous, and don't miss the breakfast potatoes! This past weekend, the Chef's special was a phenomenal Chilaquiles (we got a vegetarian version) - the roasted corn with chile lime butter was fantastic and the chef actually came out to see how we liked it (super nice guy!).

Overall, it's always a great experience eating at Luci's!

The 2 rating is not for the food which is delicious or the service which is great. The 2 rating is for the hostess manager who is very nice and pleasant to the customers. Thank you for being great. However, as I was sitting at the cook's bar it was painful to watch her hover over the cook's and clearly make them uncomfortable with demanding food from them quickly. It made me uncomfortable as well. These guys are working their butts off to provide delicious meal and the hostess manager is micromanaging their efforts. I would rather wait for my food to be prepared correctly than to have it rushed. My friend and I told the cooks they were doing an excellent job and thanked them for the delicious breakfast. We thought they needed to hear that.

I didn't think the food was great. The staff wasn't awesome either they kind of had the vibe like "hey I'm better than you" and my friend asked for a side of salsa and never even came back. 

It's SOOOOOOOO overpriced for this shit.

Definitely a fan! Live in the neighborhood and appreciate the atmosphere, the food and the coffee. Great meeting spot for friends or casual business meetings. The staff are always friendly and upbeat.

I was so thrilled when the BF took me here for breakfast today. It is so rare that we get to enjoy a morning together with our hectic lives. The menu looked delicious- and the Eggs Benedict special that my BF ordered was great. In no way, would I consider it "healthy" though... lol! Loaded in delicious fat... The employees were polite as well- even though the place was packed.

I ordered the kale salad... This is where things went very down hill... it was covered in oil. No dressing, but olive oil. There was so much oil on the salad that it pooled on the plate. I rarely send anything back, but it was inedible. 

They took it back and brought me out a new plate that almost looked like the same exact salad...  I ate about half of the salad- again oil pooled on the plate, but my mouth was so coated with olive oil, I was starting to feel sick. I could feel it on my lips, my chin... absolutely DISGUSTING!

Since this is what they gave us after I already sent it back for too much oil... I didn't want to complain again. I really dislike having to do that, especially since the place was very busy.

I ended up using about 27 napkins... I am NOT exaggerating.  I used about 27 napkins to ring out the kale, so that the dish would be edible. We had a huge pile of oil soaked napkins all over our table. My hands were also soaked with oil... It was ridiculous. Even the people sitting at the table next to us were shocked by the amount of oil... it was really awful. Even after using 27 napkins to soak up some of the oil... the rest was still very oily... it was just a little more tolerable. Although the employees were very polite here, they did see what was happening with the salad, but never offered to fix the plate again- and made sure not to ask how our meal was when we purchased a few miscellaneous items before departing. 

We spent about $50-60 there this morning, between food and trinkets... I'm really disappointed that such a highly regarded establishment messed up so epic on something as simple as a salad.

Additionally, I ordered that salad as I have been trying to eat healthier, but since there was definitely more than 4 tablespoons of olive oil on the salad... that salad ended up being over 600 calories... which is such a bummer.  For that amount of calories and fat, I would have rather had the eggs benedict or something a heck of a lot tastier than a kale salad. I should have just not eaten it, but I wanted to enjoy the rare breakfast out with the BF. 

I don't think we will come here again because of this experience.

I've gotten my daily grind @ a national chain coffee shop on 16th st & Bethany home rd for quite som time until wandering into Luci's Healthy Marketplace on the opposite corner. Talk about day vs. night!! Luci's harks back to the days of the neighborhood market/coffee house where the propriator and employees not only know your name but how you like your morning Joe! I find that the people working here genuinely ENJOY doing so and are eager to give their customers the kind of experience that is all too often missing in todays frenetic world. I had been meaning to try something from their dinner menu and recently had the opportunity. The home made chicken pot pie sounded like just the thing to brighten up a rainy day so I ordered up one and had a seat at the counter in front of the chef. It isnt often that you get to sit and watch your food prepared to order before your eyes but here I was, comfortably enjoying a conversation with a few other patrons and chatting with the chef while he prepared my meal. The pot pie comes in a HUGE tin which lends itself to transport home, filled with a thick, hearty broth LOADED with fresh perfectly prepared vegetables and plump, juicy chicken. Gently placed atop of the filling is a lite, flaky puff pastry shell which gives the pie the perfect amount of texture and crunch. I REALLY hoped this pie tasted as good as it looked and soon enough I was able ta put spoon to meal and enjoy my first bite...the verdict...it was DELICIOUS!!!! that this is probably the BEST pot pie i've EVER had from the most unlikely of locations is a testament to the involvement of the owners, Ken & Luci Schnitzer who can be found daily making their customers feel like welcomed family. I HIGHLY recommend dropping in to have a meal, a superbly prepared coffee drink or some of their ADDICTIVE house iced tea...a Mediterranean pomagranite citrus green tee.
People here weren't really friendly. I didn't feel welcomed at all. I really hate it because they had some dope little gifts there. /:

I have had both good and bad experiences here. The staff are friendly and happy, and their coffee bar delicious. But I can't get over waiting almost an hour while watching people come in and out, on a sidewalk table, cooking in the sun, because the person running the takeouts didn't check the entire restaurant before deciding to abandon finding me. This is despite the fact I was directly outside the front door and glass windows with my table number prominently displayed on the table flag.
