I finally left my dog, unattended on the sidewalk to go in and find out what happened to be told, "oh we were looking for you!" In an almost accusatory tone. I pointed directly through the window to my frantic dog. They asked if I had my number, and I again pointed to the window. I reminded them it had been over 45 minutes since I placed my order. They were unapologetic and even suggestive that it was my fault  because they couldn't find me. I was directly out front and prominently visible!! They wanted me to wait for the manager to decide he was free to talk to me, to which I informed them I could not because my dog was unattended, hot, and without water -I truly did not expect my 8:30 am Saturday breakfast take out run would have me outside in the heat for that long. I got home, a mile away, and the omelet did not look appealing after that long containment in the plastic, and my coffee was no longer hot. I think what left my the most upset (I get it, mistakes can happen) is there was a sense of such a lack of ownership for their mess up to not thoroughly check for their waiting customers. All I wanted was an acknowledgment and apology....

I live down the street from Luci's and sadly for me, I won't be visiting them any longer. First, they're slow and they are pricey.  I paid $10 for a dragon fruit bowl-- it was served in a cute, shallow wood bowl but the strawberries and kiwi that topped the bowl were gross! The strawberries were too soft and the kiwi was hard and SOUR, which was even worse because they gave me a lot of it (which would be great if they had better produce) A few days later I decided to try again and  came in and order 2 to go, substituting bananas and blueberries instead of the strawberries and kiwi.  We also paid $2 for extra granola ($1 each) since there wasn't much on the previous bowl. After waiting for 15+ minutes for my smoothie bowls, they arrived and they were in a much SMALLER container than the other day when I ordered it to eat in the restaurant.  Also, there were 4 banana slices and 2 blueberries on both of the smoothies, WHAT?? our "extra" granola that we paid for never showed, there was a tablespoon AT MOST.  We called and complained about this because it was so expensive (about $22 after tax) and we were told by a manager, Elizabeth, that they would leave a gift card up at the front for us the next time that we came in.  Within a few days I called in an order for another 2 smoothie bowls, again substituting in bananas and blueberries and extra granola.  After my arrival they said there was no such gift card but they could give me $2 off order to pay for my extra granola that I didn't receive the previous time... At that point I didn't feel like arguing so I took the offer. When my smoothie bowls arrived the fruit was in the bottom, they were hardly over  3\4 of the way through and the 2nd smoothie bowl and hardly any grandola and zero fruit. 

I may ususally be more forgiving because they live so close to me, but I don't look forward to getting ripped off again. Luci's has been a waste of my money and a waste of my time. I will not be going back.

I love the idea of Luci's and I've had some great experiences here. The staff is always friendly and the lattes are great. I haven't tried the food yet but that's definitely next on my list. Unfortunately they are pretty overpriced and their iced coffee is just not my cup of tea. This morning I paid almost $8 for a small iced coffee (which I wasn't a fan of) and a decent but a little dry muffin. I would give them 3.5 stars if that was an option.

Decided to stop in here during a workday for lunch since it's right down the street from my office. The weather was nice out so they had the wall of doors open by the seating area inside. The menu had a variety of items to fit anyone's cravings. I decided to go with the soup of the day (tomato w/cilantro) and a side house salad with homemade pesto, blue cheese dressing. Both were fantastic! Cute little spot for grabbing coffee, breakfast or lunch. I will be back for sure!
My new place for wi-fi and iced coffee. Breakfast is great also. Good service, easy location. On my good list. When you are done with coffee, don't forget to pick up a few healthy things for later.

Made it to Luci's after 3 years, was not impressed the first time I went when they first opened but they have stepped up their game. 

NOW: with their leaning towards healthy goods and good for you foods, there were NO vegan options in pastries. strange..but lots of gluten free, GF does not make a vegan happy. Perhaps consult with a vegan? 

My latte was great, almond milk vanilla latte. love that they have these options! 

I was SHOCKED and amazed to look at their dinner menu and see that they served veal. As we all know, Veal is baby cows taken from their mothers at birth and locked in a box for 6-10 weeks and then slaughtered. This is promoting animal violence and cruelty and I cannot support a business that does this.

I think Luci's is confused about their identity, here is healthy food (some of the best brands are here in their store) and then there is VEAL, no they don't cancel each other out and you can't make everyone happy Luci's. Pick an identity and go with it. Until I hear differently about the cruelty you choose to condone, you have lost my support.
The salads were delicious. The kids enjoyed their flap jacks. And I highly recommend the chocolate dipped coconut macaroon!
Food was okay, really good lemonade and service was okay... No one asked us how we were doing but friendly food runner

First off I love Luci, great place for coffee, love the atmosphere. Love meeting friends there. I have had breakfast there 3 x's  and all three times my omelette was pretty bad, they always seem to over cook the eggs, a brown scorched omelette.. The potatoes were parboiled, OK I can understand that, but at least brown the potato's a little   on the grill .. They looked like they we put on grill 30 seconds.. I cant be the only one who has had a bad omelette here and 3 times.. Maybe Cuz its a busy Saturday and Sunday.. I really would love to enjoy a omelette there...

Great place for breakfast/brunch or just to grab a drink! Friendly staff, fun atmosphere!  Plus a neat little grocery area and fun "gifts with whimsy."  A little loud at meal times but mid afternoon better tea and more character than Starbucks!!

Food is super yummy. A little pricey though, especially when you see the cashier poor orange juice out of the carton that was bought from a grocery store and charged like 3$ for it. I much would have rather seen the juice being  dispensed from a machine or poured in front of me   The breakfast and muffins are delish! 

I will say this, and I'm sure others can agree while dining there, TOO MANY FLY's. Each time I sit and eat, I'm disturbed by all the flys on my food. Maybe they can find a way to get them out of the eating area or use a fly trap to help with the problem. 

Overall, I will continue to come here because they have amazing pancakes and food is really good!

Good coffee, good food, gluten free options for everything, great atmosphere (especially in off summer months). I really enjoy this place! It's a grocery store too and has a ton of great healthy options for food to take home. If I am ever in the area and can, I try to move all my business meetings and lunches to this place. I just like being there.

I really wanted to like this place after reading the reviews. However, finding parking for this place is a HORRIBLE experience. There's very few parking spots and this place is located on a busy intersection. Nevertheless, the atmosphere once you enter is wonderful. There's a cafe inside featuring a small organic and trendy market. The barista was very friendly. However, the vanilla latte was burnt and I've had better coffee elsewhere.

My review is actually on the meal service that Luci's provided for Thanksgiving.  The family had some issues to deal with over the holidays and the thought of creating a big meal was overwhelming so I shopped around and after much debate settled on Luci's for the meal.  I really can't describe how happy I was with my choice.

The food was AMAZING.  I've had pre-bought meals like this before, but this actually all tasted like something that came out of a kitchen with a cook that cared about what they were serving to their own guests.  Seasonings were pronounced, yet mild and the fresh herbs could be seen throughout.  There were options to select from and rather than getting piddly little portions, you received enough to actually feed a family.  The highlights of the meal were the mashed potatoes (seriously how they made these is still beyond me because they were SO light and fluffly), the green bean caserole that was better than anything coming out of that campbell's can, the seasonal salad that could be substituted for any side, and the turkey itself.

Every single person at the table raved about each component of the meal and the fact that it was made with locally sourced ingredients just makes it all the better.  To top everything off, they loaded everything into the car and the packaging was perfect for both transport as well as storage (because there were a ton of leftovers).

I will absolutely do this again and would recommend them to anyone looking to simplify while still holding on to traditions.  Call ahead because I was told that I literally got the last meal as they had not counted on them being so popular but don't call too far ahead becuase I might have to fight you for your turkey. :)

Luci's is a nice little marketplace and cafe! I had been here a few times in the past but I think today was my first time actually ordering a meal from Luci's. The store itself is fun, a lot of cool gift/ novelty item type things to check out. The menu has quite a few tasty looking options on there! I usually don't go for sandwiches but I decided to try the naughty nurse and I enjoyed it! Everything on it tasted fresh and I liked the multigrain bread. I chose  berries as my side and some of them liked a tad funky, but mostly good. I also got a snickerdoodle cookie which was the star of the show. When I ordered it I couldn't tell if it was going to be hard or soft, but I got lucky and it was a delicious soft cookie, I thought it was excellent. I hope to come back to try the black bean burger!

Great place to grab a quick coffee or bite, but also a great place for breakfast.  The oatmeal here is almost as good as Taylor's Cafe but the omelettes are pretty tasty and come with a sweet potato hash that I wish more places would serve.  The good news is that if you are here just for coffee, the pastry case is better than at any Starbucks.  You can also wander around the store and get some other groceries.  (Its not the cheapest, think Whole Foods) but it does feel like a great neighborhood place.  Parking is not great though, so be forewarned, carpool if you can!

Luci's what has happened to you? I ordered the special. I should have been worried when the cashier didn't know what the special was. After sorting that out we sat down to wait for our food the food runner came over to ask what kind of bread because they were out of English muffins. The special was supposed to be on a bagel. So I suggested a bagel would be fine. The food came and it was lackluster looking. My companion ordered the roast beef sandwich and it looked like a sandwich an 8 year old would make. There was very little meat and cheese and what was there looked like they scraped the bottom of the fridge for them. It was also missing the horseradish mayo. My "special" was anything but. The bagel the sandwich was made with was cold while the rest of the ingredients were warm. It also tasted stale and old. The sandwich was also missing the Swiss cheese. This experience saddened me. I used to love the quality of food at Luci's and it has slipped so much that I downloaded the yelp app and wrote this review in hopes that they will take notice and do better.

Our home away from home. 

Great food, SENSATIONAL staff, and a fun, casual atmosphere that is conducive for getting some work on the laptop done. 

The Spaniard Omelette is great, and the iced Green Tea is legit. 

There is a small, eclectic "market" inside which is fun. Think "Joot N' Hoops" and healthy food, you get the idea. 

We have also hosted events with 10+ people her and it has been fun. They also do cooking classes during the week which is very cool as well. Just a great vibe with great people.

We were craving a Sunday morning latte so we started driving towards  Starbucks on Bethany Home and 16th st when we saw Luci's kitty corner across the street. It looked so cute with the garage door open and looked full of activity. They had a little farmers market in front with fresh produce from a local farm being sold. 

I had a soy latte , my husband had a vanilla latte and we split the egg sammie. The lattes were really good and I agree the corrugated cups are way better than those "sleeves" you get at other coffee places. The egg sammie was really big, it looked more like an omelet squished between a bagel. 

The total for everything was $14 which seemed a little high but you can tell everything was made with quality ingredients so the price is worth it. The lunch menu sounds great and consists of mostly sandwiches and salads. This is a fun place to meet with friends or just stop in for a good cup of coffee.

Quaint & funky, I enjoy coming into Luci's from time to time.  I actually live within walking distance, & could come more often, but I find them to be a little pricey.  I've had breakfast, lunch, and dinner there & so far my fave (by far) has been the lunch.  Their roast beef sammie was fab!!  Sadly, you can't order from their lunch menu after 5p.  Recently I had their pasta plus protein.  Same as with the breakfast omlettes, you can upgrade your basic selection a little at a time.  So, start with pasta & your choice of sauce.  Next level would be to add veggies ( a choice of about 5 or so), and from their, you can upgrade to adding protein - choice of chicken or shrimp - while still having veggies.  Like the concept and a HUGE portion, but the pasta had a funky texture.  Maybe I got gluten free by mistake.  You can stop in here for a quick treat or to pick up some healthy alternatives, but it's not a regular pick of mine.

OH!  I almost forgot the cooking classes!  What a fantastic idea and I love that they are offered by category.  I can't wait until the "Knife Skills" class comes back.  I've always wanted to chop & dice like a pro!

I was going between four and five stars so I think 4.5 stars is accurate. I went just this morning with my boyfriend before he caught his flight to Iceland (seriously I'm jealous but one of us has to work!) The place is super cute and trendy which is on par for the neighborhood. But the latte I had this morning was one of the best I've ever had it was not too sweet and not bitter at all. I was fighting my boyfriend over it as he was going to wait to get one until we left but then he tried mine and wanted it! I hope Iceland has great coffee babe! We also got the Egg Sammy with scrambled egg, provolone, bacon on a bagel, and the Crazy Monkey French Toast. The Sammy was delicious and had the perfect amount of melted cheese. I love the French toast but my boyfriend was not as thrilled with it but hear me out. It's true it was almost lukewarm instead of hot and my boyfriend said it seemed like it was reheated. While that might be true I personally like my food at a more room temperature, probably so I can eat it a lot faster because I'm a fat kid at heart- so for me it was perfect! The bread was also very dense and I like that it had a lot of texture to it. Unfortunately I moved out of the area about a year ago but I look forward to making this another regular spot for me again! Be sure to check out the shop as they have tons of unique silly items!

I appreciate what Luci's is going with their store. It's cool, the food is good, and their little store selection is intriguing. Sure it's crowded but who can blame a place for being popular? Not this Yelper.

That said, my verdict has always been out on Luci's. Not that it really matters because the place has like 300 reviews so its rating isn't going anywhere, but every visit I've had is just somewhat imperfect. Nothing big to scream about -- but small mistakes here and there. 

For example, yesterday we ordered our breakfasts plus 1 small and 1 medium coffee. The cashier rings it up then says, "We're currently out of small cups so they'll both be in mediums." So when our name is called and we grab the coffees, there are two medium cups but one is just partially full. Like, seriously, what is that? You're really going to skimp on the few ounces of DRIP COFFEE? Who does that? How do you even know you gave us the volume of a small and didn't short us? I get that she said they'd both be in medium cups but, man, talk about seeming cheap!

So that's the kind of stuff that just eats away at me, visit after visit. I want to love Luci's the way so many others do but they JUST won't let me. It's hard when it's always SOMETHING and, I don't know, I think maybe I'll just have to accept that Luci's just isn't for me.

Such a big fan the family and I ate her 3 mornings while on our Spring Break.  The kids loved the kid pancakes, fresh fruit and yummy potatoes.  Lots of variety to choose from for adults too.  From omelets to bagel sandwiches, this place hit the spot.  Great baristas and specialties to choose from iced coffee, hot coffee and lattes.  We will be back on our next trip!

I was a bit torn on Lucy's. They're local and have made great use of their space so add a star.

The serve up a decent cup of coffee and their treats from the coffee bar so add another star.

I haven't had anything else on their menu but everything looks good so watch this space for another star.

I'm less than impressed by the actual market part. Their shelves are stocked but I can never see myself coming here for groceries. Minus a star  :(

All that said, I was desperate on the Friday before Christmas as I needed fresh basil. I managed to score the last package at Sprouts but I then proceed to dash all over the Biltmore area in search for the second package. No luck at Safeway, Fry's or Basha's. On a whim I popped into Luci's and scored the fresher looking of two packages of basil that looked sadly beyond their shelf lives. At this point though, I had no choice.

The young guy who rang me up noticed the sorry state of my basil and after determining the poor quality of the other package proceeded to go into the store room and return with another package of FRESH fresh basil. OUTSTANDING service and attention to detail that would have been overlooked anywhere else. ADD 2 STARS for being exceptional!

I still don't think that all of my grocery needs will be met here and I don't think that that is their goal. But I appreciate exceptional service like I received here so I plan to purchase what I can here. If nothing else, it's a perfect time to go back and sample their menu.

Well done Luci's!

Best place in the valley to get a coffee. If you like LGO you'll love this place. Same principal without the crowds and stress that LGO has. You can actually relax here and hear yourself think. I had their Breakfast Burrito this last Sunday and I can say with out a doubt that it was the best Breakfast Burrito I have ever had, and I know my Breakfast Burritos. Another great idea, and this goes for any coffee shop, other than Starbucks because they don't have it, use Almond Milk in your Mocha instead of regular or non-fat. It is amazing. My next plan is to try their cooking classes.

Luci's is my go-to place for networking with other professionals over coffee. The staff is sweet, the coffee is good, and the hot chocolate is awesome. I feel very well taken care of when I'm here. The food is quite good too and they have many options for  people with gluten sensitivities. The only problem I have with Luci's is the tables are spaced too close together.
The food is delicious. The burrito bomb breackfast burro is amazing. Pancakes are to good to miss. Sandwichs and pizza are very good.  Service is Great.  Parking could be better.

If there is one thing Phoenix does really really well, it's breakfast, and this place has phenomenal breakfast. I knew I was in for a treat cause the line was out the door when I arrived. I ordered the "Moe", which was an egg omelette with veggies inside, with a side of very delicious turkey sausage, with swiss cheese on top, and a cup of fruit. It hit the spot to say least. They have a regular market, coffee shop, and trinket shop too, so it's a very welcoming place to just hang out at if you want. Will be coming back again for sure. I think they have vegetarian cooking classes too. Maybe I should sign up

Just had breakfast here.  We had the Big Boy Breakfast and the Egg Sammie.  Both are very tasty!  Coffee is delicious....recommend the dirty chia for a change of pace.  Will be back to try the lunch menu.

I stopped by here on my way home a few Friday's ago.  I have to say they have a good selection of vegan, frozen organic and other natural type of foods.  

The main attraction however is the coffee/juice bar.  I had a delicious berry smoothy and was quite pleased with it.  The food is also really good.  The atmosphere is typical of a coffee shop.  I think that I was the only person in the place without a laptop.  There is a television on the back wall that serves no purpose (why I bring this up?  I wonder why it is there in the first place..........)

I recommend it.  Neat decor and a place to get a way for a quick snack or coffee.

Review Update:  

Just as I expected... a credit has been issued to my bank in the incorrect amount! 

Owed: $20.59 
Pending Credit: $14.10

I suppose they expect me to track down the Uber driver to refund the initial delivery fee! 

Luci's Healthy Marketplace if you're so hard up for cash, I suggest you consider Chapter 11.

So, it took awhile, but I finally made my way into Luci's recently... I was driving southbound on 16th street and made a spontaneous decision to stop by.  I'd done this once before, but it was when they were closed due to the fire at nearby Richardson's.  But, they are re-opened now, and they are still on fire... (this time just metaphorically speaking).

I ordered an iced tea at the coffee bar and browsed around a bit.  I bumped into Ken, the owner, who gave me a bit of history and a tour of this adorable boutique-ish neighborhood grocer.  I learned that they revamped their staff from their initial opening, including hiring Chef Eric Guerin, and while I didn't eat while I was there, I will for sure be back to do so soon... the menu looks great; especially their omelet selection!  

I could've spent hours looking around - they carry a variety of unique health food, vitamins, and eco-freindly natural products.  I ended up purchasing some vitamins (thanks Lucia for your help with that) and a citrus smelling Weleda brand natural deodorant (I hear so many bad things about regular deodorant, so I am going to give this stuff a shot).

My next visit to Luci's will be sooner than later for sure...  I can tell, I'd be a regular if it was a tad bit closer to home.

I love that I can get a hemp milk late here! The only downside is that the last time I was here it was getting to be pretty hot outside yet they insisted on keeping the large windows/doors open so it became a little difficult to drink my late while having to wave away pesky flies.

I am not sure how this place has a four-star rating.  We went there for dinner and we were one of only four tables.  It took 20 minutes for one person's food to arrive and then another five minutes for the second person's food to arrive.  Once our food arrived, it was barely edible.  My tater tots were frozen on the inside and my tuna melt bread was not grilled, it was soggy, and the tuna in the sandwich was cold.  Yuk.
I work across the street so I find myself in here for breakfast a lot. They do breakfast all day and its phenomenal.

I stopped into this market yesterday because it was on my way to work. Well worth the stop! As I walked through the doors I was instantly greeted by 3 or 4 staff members. I made my way over to the coffee/smoothie bar and was very impressed with the selection! I had a fruit smoothie with berries and it was fantastic! Not only was it delicious, but the marketplace had very corky and fun little gifts! I will definitely be back! Great job Lucis!

Great place, I pass by here every Wednesday going to Hobe Meats and I finally decided to stop in here. Customer service is beyond a 5 star rating, I was just shopping for christmas presents and they acted like I've been going there for years. I didn't have time to seat and eat but I did grab a cupcake and scone on my way out. My dad enjoyed his cupcake, he's not big on sugar so it was perfect and the scone was delicious, not over powering in sugar so it was a nice treat:)

After finding ourselves lost in a dry riverbed along the freeway, David and I decided to give in and call our early morning hike a done deal.  Our planned destination was Piestewa Peak but we were off course, so way off course.  After running around aimlessly for a bit, posing for pics and climbing a small hill we headed to Luci's for breakfast. We were really looking forward to it as it was a first visit for the both of us. The space is really cool, interesting products, great layout, a cool diner counter and super friendly staff. All that being said, my meal (egg Sammy on asiago bagel) was average and fell just a tad short of my expectations considering the anticipation and how great it read on the menu.  On a brighter side, David was thrilled with his "special request" latte. Evidently there are restrictions on allowable ounces on coffee products sold. He had his heart set on a super size big gulp version of a latte and the staff being super accommodating allowed for this "one time" exception and in my eyes a redeeming point lost on my Sammy.  Luci, for this I grant you back the lost point and a promise to return in the near future.  Thank you.

How have I not been here before? Such a fun place to hang out and grab a drink and GF pastry with your friends. Great lunch salads. And GF double chocolate muffin ! 
Try it, you won't regret it! 
They also have a little store in the back to look around while your food is being prepared.

I love breakfast foods, problem is my butt does not get out of bed that early on weekends.  LOL!  They only had 1 register working and that line was getting a little long.  The menus were not available to review until you walk up in line.  Then you can see the on the electronic boards.  I got the EGG SAMMIE with turkey. It was ok.  Pretty bland.  I wanted to get the french toast but no one wanted to share with me...  BUMMER!  Finding a seat, that was NOT fun.  Got a table all the way in the back by the beer.

We wanted to grab a quick bite after a jewelry making class we took in the same shopping center.  It was almost 8 and apparently the kitchen was about to close so the first thing I ordered wasn't available so I went with the veggie burger.  It was the frozen chipotle Gardenburger from Costco, but it hit the spot.  Had the pasta salad on the side which was quite good.  Really cute little market though.  Had a chance to browse and saw a lot of interesting items for sale.  I'm not in the area too often, but if I worked close by or something this would probably be a spot I would grab take out from on a regular basis.

This place stinks for 2 reasons. Food is too pricey & THE PEOPLE BEHIND THE COUNTER DON'T SHUT THEIR YAPPERS LONG ENOUGH TO ACTUALLY HEAR YOUR ORDER. Then you have to repeat it two more times which is annoying for me & everyone else behind me. Please stop the shiny happy people routine and let me have my coffee.

All I can say is, I wish it were my neighborhood store.

An Alta Dena lactose product, a BST sandwich [bacon spinach and tomato], and beet chips crackling beside me ...

I LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS PLACE! They have the best smoothies and lattes. I could come here everyday for hours and just take all of its super cute atmosphere in. All of the nicknacks in here are adorable!

I love Luci's! It's such a unique spot, I love that there is a store in the restaurant. The store carries all kinds of healthy food items as well as some random nicknacks. This place is great for coffee, breakfast, or to grab a light lunch or dinner (lots of great salads and sandwiches).

Went to Luci's this morning for cappuccino and a light breakfast. Was super impressed with the friendly service. From the minute we walked in and were greeted from behind the counter to the person who cleared our table...it was great!  More than what you would normally receive or expect from a counter service coffee spot.

The coffee and special breakfast sandwich were quite good. Loved all of the fun gifty items in the store to browse and the seating was comfy and casual. A good start to the first morning of our vacation!
Wonderful food that is health conscious and tastes great. Had the wild salmon sandwich, honestly one of the better sandwiches I have had with fish in the phoenix area.
I happened on this cute little grocery store/ cafe while on the way to find something else. Basically it's a smaller Whole Foods but with a more unique twist.

Welllll, I had BIG expectations from this place! First off, any place with HEALTHY in their name is pretty much screaming at me to stop in. I had added Luci's Healthy Marketplace to my Instagram a while back, not sure how. Probably stumbled upon a picture of something that looked extremely tasty, followed by the name "healthy" and I'm there!!! So my first impression...I was handed my take out bag with clear, finger marks of grease on the outside, (which I will be posting a picture of!) Having taken a few nutrition classes, the term "vegetarian" "vegan" etc does NOT necessarily make it healthy! I understand organic and fresh local produce and can definitely appreciate that in my meal choice! I tasted just that in the vegetables although I was disappointed with what I ordered :/ I ordered the Veg Out Sammie. Usually, I see a long list of veggies and I'm all about it. Well that's basically what I ended up with. Raw veggies between 2 pieces of multigrain bread with a little bit of vegan mayo. No seasoning, spices, no sauce= NO FLAVOR! OK, I take that back...the roasted prepped was very flavorful! Haha, no skill for that! Just not impressed. When I'm paying about $10 for a sandwich i would expect something special about it. I have no limitation to my diet...not diabetic, no food allergies, not vegetarian. Therefore, I feel like I may as well have ordered something full of cheese and sauce and fat so there was flavor because I'm left completely dissatisfied! I enjoyed my dessert, a very, moist, salted dark chocolate caramel cookie (which came from an outsource!) So, what's for lunch?!

Loved this place, the food, and the vibe. I haven't seen a shop like this in Phoenix so far. It's something between a micro whole foods, local coffeeshop, and a casual restaurant. I could see the most of the kitchen in the store. There are plenty of comfortable seats; friendly staff and the waiter makes it even cozier. I had a Wild Salmon sandwich with baked zucchini and really enjoyed it. It was both healthy and delicious. Luci's is now one of my favorite places in Phoenix and I highly recommend it.

I stopped because I wanted somthing cold and delicious. I saw Frappe Chai (way cool), it gave you the option of regular milk or soy.Which is fantastic since me and dairy aren't the best of friends. For some reason I like to read for myself the option than asking someone, so seeing that I knew thats what I wanted. Iced Chai into a Frappicino...and with Soy?! - YES Please!

I was greeted fairly quickly, I had the option of 20oz or 32oz. I controlled myself and got the 20oz, cost $4.33. The board said 5 bucks, but who am I to correct the employee when its in my favor?! LOL, I'm sure it was some type of happy hour though.

During the transaction, the cashier stopped to pass on a message to another employee, apoligezed and finished up. I'm noting this only becuase the employee she talked to, walked out to the customers who were sitting at the tables. Asking if they want a to go box, wiping down counters, basically asking them how it was going. Waitress duties but without the restaruant, pretty nice!

I walked around while waiting, they had so many cute things!! The magnets were pretty funny, at 5bucks I might pick up a few next time. They had these really cute headbands, I picked up and put right back down when I say the price - $9.99. To much...for a headband atleast!! I didn't go to far into the Market, but stayed around the souviner type section.

Well waiting I got annoyed because a woman who walked in a minute behind me got her iced drink first. When I walked back to the counter, the employees back was to me, telling her coworker she made this twice. Turned around, smiled and handed my drink over, "Frappe Chai with SOY." Emphasis on the soy.
*Lightbulb*
She had to remake my drink because she used regular milk. Annoyance gone! Thank you for realizing the mistake and fixing it! Not passing it off as soy. My tummy thanks you to!

The reason why I haven't tried this place up until now is because parking is horrendous! However, I wanted to try a new place to eat and get coffee so here I am! 

Hello, Luci! We walk in and we see the sign, "coffee bar" so I thought we just order coffee and order food somewhere else. However, the girl before us started ordering food so I'm looking everywhere for a menu - look to the right, there it is! I spend some time on the menu - it's pretty extensive. The fianc√© and I decide on splitting the huevos rancheros and I got an iced vanilla latte with almond milk. We wait for our drinks - get a number and have a seat. I love the layout, but it can get a little confusing.

The vanilla latte was ok - not my favorite. The huevos rancheros was also meh. After eating, we start browsing the aisles. I like it - I normally eat paleo so it's nice to have this place near me in case I need any ingredients. Their spices are half off! I got excited - call me spice crazy. I wanted to get them all, but I knew I had most of them already. 

Anywho, I'd probably come back. House wine bottles are $10 so that's a good deal!

One of my favorite places to go for food and studying. Nice chill place to go for an afternoon.

Update: still love this place but Im currently being attacked by flies. The garage doors aren't even open today so I can't explain the surplus of flies : (

Okay, they don't have Malibu but the DO have my favorite coconut water, C2O. It's in a can and they sell it by the case. I LOVE IT! 

A writer's group I belong to meets here monthly. Free Wi-Fi and large tables are definitely a plus. On cooler Phoenix evenings, they lift the door and the place is breezy and pleasant. 

Try the Dirty Doctor and you might end up nursing a Luci-style sandwich hangover. The Melt has Luci's house-baked turkey, roast beef, cheddar, avocado, horseradish mayo and their signature barbecue sauce :) 

Saturday is Jazz Night: haven't stopped in yet but am intrigued...

And if you get stuck for parking, try the backdoor. It's easy access :)

What a great place to get coffee, tea or a multitude of various drinks.
They also serve wonderful food and pastries as well. I love that you can buy a few healthy groceries and little kitschy items too. 

A favorite meet up spot for my friends and I.

I've found myself at Luci's several times in the last few weeks as it on the way home from my doctor's office.  I am glad to see that is pretty busy every time I stop in because it is a great little market.  I do find the selection a bit odd, but I always find a few things to take home with me.  I haven't found anything specifically earth shattering, but some unique and solid stuff.  

I've enjoyed the super friendly service that I encounter every time I'm in and that they have an eclectic and fun menu.  I've tried the pumpkin spice latte, as well as the veggiesaurus melt.  The melt was just okay- I loved the mozzarella but the artichokes and peppers seemed a bit overwhelming.  Maybe throw in another veggie?  I also requested fruit instead of the potato salad and my strawberries were in pretty bad shape- they needed to be thrown out rather than served to me.  

I'm sure that Luci's will be in my regular rotation since I drive by it so often.  I'm looking forward to trying out their themed dinners soon.

Had never eaten here before, only coffee and tea on weekends before I went to another nearby option for brunch, lunch or dinner. I now have to put this in the rotation for food, as the Cobb Salad I enjoyed at lunch was superb, with an avocado citrus dressing that was perfect, and accompanied by a great green tea Arnold Palmer. My dining companion had the pancakes and raved about them as well. Already looking forward to my next visit to explore more of the menu, and grab an iced mocha while I'm at it.

3rd time here hoping for better than it is. Always below my expectations. Just because it looks like La Grande Orange, doesn't mean you'll get a comparable product or experience.  It has a long ways to go.

I've been to Luci's once and was fairly impressed with their marketplace area. I did not try their coffee, so I can't comment on that, but I glanced at their menu and the coffee selection seems decent.

I love that I can find all the great organic and non SLS beauty products here. They also carry my new favorite snack, Bumble Bars in assorted flavors. 

The day I went my husband and I were greeted by a very friendly employee who told us about some upcoming things they plan to do such as cooking classes in the store. 

I do find their prices on certain items to be a bit high. 

If you shop places like Healthy Habit and/or Trader Joe's this place is somewhat similar.

Only complaint is the parking lot, but I've had issues with that lot for years.

I've been a long time customer of Lucis. I've visited Lucis close to 100 times over the past few years and have always had a positive experience. I've brought out of town guests to lucis because it has been one of my favorite places. Today, I was thoroughly disappointed. Ordered 2 iced vanilla lattes, a bagel, and oatmeal. Lattes came out as regular lattes. No big deal, added vanilla syrup and the almond milk one was WAY too sweet. Again, no big deal. Honest mistake and the barista remade the latte. Bagel came out, great! After 30 minutes the oatmeal was still not ready. I went to check on it and asked why it was taking so long. I received a sarcastic response that they were still working on it. I'm sorry, but I know it doesn't take 30 minutes to make oatmeal. When the oatmeal was finally brought out it was just set down on the table and the server walked away. No, "I'm sorry." Nothing.

The oatmeal was still raw and crunchy. It honestly wasn't edible. At this point we left. I'm disappointed. The gentleman who brought the oatmeal used to be my very favorite barista! :(

Maybe it was just an off day. Not sure. But I won't be going back anytime soon

I am a frequent visiter in Phoenix and a family member recommended Luci's for breakfast. Luci's is a cute, casual, and delicious spot for food. I really enjoy the Acai (Amazonian fruit) super fruit bowl. They have a good collection of baked goods, and a wonderful variety to choose from. The drink selection is satisfying as well.

   Luci's has great seating, I never have trouble finding a seat. This seating including about seven bar stools in front of where the chefs cook food.

      In the middle of all the seating, there is a gourmet grocery and assortment of retro toys like wind up toys, fake glasses, books, pranks, and much more. Great small gift ideas. The store is always nice to browse, and in the middle of the rest of the restaurant. The overall pricing is moderate.

      I highly recommend Luci's for all who are looking for a comfy, enjoyable meal.

Cute place had a late breakfast here. Wait staff friendly and food was delicious. You have to Order at counter but line moved quickly. Great little store and cute shopping center which can be hard to find parking at. 
Prices seem reasonable and the pastry case is inviting. Took a little treat home which was wonderful and devoured it in private. Seating can be challenging but I wouldn't hesitate to go again.

I always feel a sense of guilt having to write a less than stellar review after meeting the owner of a restaurant. 

Lucia was Beautiful and sweet, and a pleasure to meet, my lunch, however, was not fit to eat. 

I ordered the THE HUMM-DINGER VEGAN WRAP: Roasted artichoke, zucchini, red bell pepper, onion, fresh spinach and hummus with a balsamic reduction drizzle, with a side of fruit and the sun dried tomato wrap. 

Notice it says "Roasted", the cashier told me the Veggies were "Grilled". Unfortunately, to my dismay, they were neither. 

Everything inside was heated up, by either stove or microwave, I'd guess the latter, and the "Sun Dried Tomato Wrap" was thin, doughy and utterly flavorless, not to mention a shocking pink color, which I'm sure was due to being naturally colored with beet juice, but did not help make things anymore appetizing. The fruit was a soggy pile of your typical pre-cut cantaloupe, honey dew mix. 

It was not what I was expecting AT ALL, when I think of a grilled veggie wrap, I imagine tasting all those veggies bursting with flavor after caramelizing on the grill, they had no flavor though. I also did not expect the temperature to be Hot, chilled would have been better in my opinion if the veggies had actually bee grilled that is. 

This lunch to me was less than average and as I sat there will my full plate in front of me I was asked how my meal was, I clearly stated my concerns as I have here and was simply told that it was a "Best Seller". 

Lucia did send over a piece of chocolate cake, which was appreciated, but unfortunately missed the mark since I'm Vegan and the desserts aren't. 

Honestly, in my opinion, aside from the market, most of the menu items are anything but healthy. 

The 3 stars is for the market, my food would have been 1.

And that folks is why I am the Lunch Snob!

It is amazing to me that this place has 4 star reviews. I met a friend for breakfast and the first thing I encountered was the long line to order food with only one cashier. This is the type of restaurant where you order your food and they bring it to the table. Since the line was long and I was waiting for my friend I sat a table to review the menu. When we finally did get in the queue to order we nearly lost our table as a gentleman grabbed the table we were sitting. I politely told him we were sitting there but he hadn't ordered either and was waiting for a friend. He ultimately conceded but he was rude. Not a good sign to have a minor argument with another patron before you even order food.

Once in the queue we waited over 10 minutes just to order. Just prior to the cashier there are all sorts of trinkets and things to purchase. I was utterly mortified when the first thing I saw was a plastic "poop"-type squeeze toy with the word "POOP" in big letters on the packaging. 
Now I am a medical provider and am not the queasy type, but this is in such poor taste, I should have left right then. 

I ordered an omelet and was just shocked that is had absolutely zero flavor. It was $13 dollars (with a cup of coffee) for omelet and potatoes. The potatoes were inconsistent and hot and cold in the same bite. And no flavor. Zero, zip, zilch.
The service was fair and we sat in our coveted table for an hour after we finished eating and no one picked up our dirty dishes or even asked if we were done. 
Would never recommend would never go back. And there is nothing very healthy about this place.

this is my favorite place for breakfast. i dont get to eat there often but always look forward to a green tea smoothie, with the burrito bomb (chx chorizo w/ sun dried tomato wrap) and the blueberry flapjacks are incredible.

If I could give Luci's six stars, I would! I am gluten-free and dairy-free by necessity. I get so tired of having to shop in several stores (usually Whole Foods, Fresh & Easy and Fry's) to fill my pantry and still feeling as if I missed out. Today, I discovered Luci's and was I in HEAVEN! Not only do they carry most of the gluten-free items I already use, but they carry so many I have never tried! (All items are competitively priced, too!) Additionally, they have cold beer and freshly baked goods on-hand! Ken, the store owner, literally gave me a 20-minute tour of the store, made several helpful product suggestions, and then had his barista create an iced, drip coffee with rice milk for me! For anyone that knows me, this makes Ken a keeper! I generally avoid coffee bars because none seem to carry rice milk (which is my favorite alternative to dairy; soy is too harsh for me, too). Ken assured me Almond Milk is also available. As great as all of these points are, the best is that Luci's is a locally-owned business.  Oh, and they host cooking classes on Sunday nights. I will be back and I will be telling everyone about this place to the point of annoyance...  :)

Went for the first time with my family the Saturday morning before Mother's Day. The food was excellent. I was able to get a truly gluten free meal and did not get cross-contaminated at all. We love the atmosphere and funky store. It was very hard to find parking, we had to keep circling around the building waiting for someone to leave but it was worth it.

I really like this place. This was my first time here after driving by it several times. Met a friend for breakfast and had the huevos rancheros plate. The side of lentil pico de gallo was amazing. My one year old enjoyed the kiddie flap jacks. 

I didn't get a chance to look at the entire market since I was on a time crunch but I hope to be back soon. 

The only thing disappointing here is the access to the restroom. I had to take my daughter there and had to wait until the line to order died down just so I could squeeze through. And when we were finally done, I had to wait again just to get back to my seat. Not convenient and I'm not even sure it's wheelchair accessible. Not cool. Or maybe I'm missing another restroom somewhere else there?
What is there not to love?? Amazing, pure, healthy food at reasonable prices and no need to worry about a server. The counter service is pretty amazing in itself.

I ordered a breakfast burrito and bagel from Luci's on a busy morning at work. I did use a delivery service to order my food, but was pleasantly surprised that it showed up fresh and hot and ready to eat! My plain ol' breakfast burrito wasn't so plain after all! On a fresh tomato and basil tortilla, with seasonal potatoes, eggs, sausage and cheese, it melted in my mouth! It also came with a fresh side of salsa which was absolutely Devine. My bagel was customized with cream cheese and sausage, and it was delicious as well. 

I have driven by Luci's every single day for over a year and never realized was a miss it was! I will defiantly be stopping by again soon! What wonderful food!

Walked over today to check it out. Only tried the lemon bar but the menu was pretty extensive and varied. It's a little pricey for me but it smelled great, so it would be something to try when I want to treat myself. 
It was very busy which is usually a good sign but the ordering process was a little confusing. The menu on the wall listed drinks only and you had to either order the specials on the chalk board (which wasn't very organized and some didn't have prices listed) or grab a paper menu once you got close enough to the counter. They  had a fridge with salads, yoghurt and juices. No dishes on the food menu were under $5 from what I saw, even a simple plate of eggs and bread. I guess you pay for the "organic" bit. However, I couldn't tell what was made there and what was fresh - I assume the baked goods are but the bagels were in bags. It probably says on the menu somewhere...
The lemon bar was tasty and very hearty, though it wasn't as flavourful as others I've tried - basically just sweet lemon. I couldn't taste the crust at all. 
The staff were all really friendly, and that's always a bonus. 
I have plans to go back tomorrow morning to try the breakfast and coffee and will update then.

----
UPDATE: Went in this morning for coffee and breakfast. Had an egg Sammie (scrambled eggs w/ your choice of cheese, meat and bread) with provolone and bacon on an English muffin. The eggs were very fluffy with real bacon bits mixed in, topped with the cheese and sandwiched in the muffin, sliced in half. It's a decent portion size - however, since this is something I make at home all the time for myself, I'm not sure if the $7 was worth it, but it was still a really good, filling breakfast. I also got a 12 oz. of the day's house blend and added in low fat milk and sugar myself. The coffee wasn't very strong but that's my fault for not asking for the more bold blend. Mom's slice of quiche (which she said was very good), my Sammie, a mocha and a cup of coffee was nearly $20. A little steep but it's a good environment and doesn't feel snobbish like a lot of Whole Foods-type places. 

My assessment of this is not a place for the casual, every day diner still stands. This is more of a place to treat yourself. I'll come back but not as a first choice.
A black tea & their fast Internet and I am good to go!

I've been wanting to come here for so long because it's a place I see other foodies post about. The only thing I regret is not having come sooner. I brought by brother for breakfast, he had the Big Boy with a pancake on the side (the pancake doesn't come with the order) and I got the flapjacks with pecans. At first I kind of felt like i was settling because the order of flapjacks is just that, it doesn't come with any sides and I never eat pancakes by themselves. Nevertheless, I was actually blown away and Luci's flapjacks were the best pancakes(flapjacks, hot cakes, whatever) I've ever had and I've never had favorite pancakes.

Although I like Luci's and continue to come back, my food seems to be always missing something. From the 12th Street location I ordered a chili burger it came with no Chili's. I ordered a Cob salad from the Bethany home location no bacon and some of the lettuce was really brown. That is consistent something is always missing. But once you get it the food is delicious.
Really good breakfast spot! My husband had pancakes and bacon and I had the potatoes medley and sourdough toast! Yum!

Food is great. Really great for a small sandwich shop. Very much like LeGrande Orange without the wall to wall people. Yummy salads, sandwiches, and confections. I love desserts but the side salad with goat cheese was great.

I strolled into Luci's on accident on a Saturday night after Dick's Hideaway was PACKED and although it's not the bar atmosphere Dick's is, they do serve and sell alcohol as well as have TVs showing sports. I was shocked to discover that this place wasn't packed. 

Their menu has a wide variety and the best part? breakfast is served ALL DAY! Although it was around 8:00 p.m. I had a hankering for something sweet and was highly satisfied with the "Funky Monkey French Toast" so much so that I'd venture to say it's the BEST french toast I've EVER eaten! 

In addition to personable and prompt service, there is plenty to peruse in the "market" while you wait. The only downside is most of the merchandise seems to sell at above an expected value. 

Still, so glad I stumbled in here!

This place tries to act like a local neighborhood cafe, but in reality is just another of those trendy, cool places that is a little overpriced and a little pretentious. 

It is not bad, just not anything special.  Will I go again? Probably, but I won't go out of my way. Meh.

I work in the businesses next door and everyone told me good things about this place from day one! I've been here twice in the short time I've been working and I LOVE it. I usually go for breakfast and the acai bowls are the best. It comes out in a small bowl but it's quite deep and you get a lot of food with it. The menu ranges from breakfast to lunch sandwiches and offers a lot of choice. I've had the crabby omelette and I was so surprised. It had a good amount of salmon and crab in it which made it super yummy. The eggs were also very fluffy and again the portions were on the larger side so you get the bang for your buck! 
 
They also have a ton of wine to choose from as well as little gifts/trinkets/candles you'd find at urban outfitters if that's your cup of tea. 

Overall I love the vibe of this place and would recommend :)

Great food & great service! 1st timer and an employee noticed I was looking over the menu quite hard and helped me out with the menu. She told me her festivities & I picked one.( the turkey lurkey) sooooo good! With a side of "tots" sweet potatoes and regular tots. Not to mention we picked up some fun trinkets. Def will be back thank you guys!

Just relocated back from Seattle and struggling to find a good coffee house that's not a Starsucks. So I was happy to stumble across this place. 

Parking not so accommodating but this center never has been and it's worth dealing with for the food, atmosphere and COFFEE!! 

I had the big boy breakfast and it was real good. The bacon was crisp but not burnt and the scrambled eggs were omelet style folded over which was a nice presentation.

Now the real kicker is that I love an ORANGE MOCHA, they actually had the orange syrup and made it so tasty. First place in Phoenix I've found, and honestly not sure I'll go looking for another. 

All the staff is friendly and talkative and they have a killer little market with fun gifts, and god healthy snacks, cheese, wine, gluten free selections, etc.  

Check it out!

Went for breakfast today and asked for two scrambled eggs and an English muffin. I was charged for a breakfast sandwich hold the meat and cheese which is a bit expensive considering I didn't order meat or cheese.. $11 including my coffee and they put cheese in the egg anyway.. Ugh. English muffin was not toasted and did I mention there was no where to park?  A bit chaotic but love the idea.

Luci's Healthy Marketplace isn't bad. The customer service is good. I had ordered a smoothie and purchased a few items. The atmosphere was nice. Its a nice place to take a friend for coffee or lunch. I did enjoy the smoothie and everything. Keep up the hard work!

First time I tried this today. The place is quite open and airy allowing a fresh breeze into the dining area. It has a organic store in the back. The food was excellent but the downfall is the wait. Our food came out at separate times about 7 minutes apart. However, getting past that, the food was very good. I had the all natural burger that came with tater tots and sweet potato tots. Those were exceptionally yummy. My boyfriend had the french toast (which I tasted) and it was cooked well. 
The place was fun and the food was great, but those dining here need to know the wait is a bit excessive.

My first time here as I'm visiting Phoenix and it was just absolutely DELICIOUS! I got the Big Boy Breakfast and my table split the Slapjacks! The eggs were well cooked, the potatoes were great and the turkey sausage was my absolute favorite part (the flavor was soooo yummy!). The Slapjacks were also awesome! There were no complaints at our table! 

The only downfall were the flies that were constantly trying to get at our food because the restaurant keeps their garage style door open - so be prepared to swat at them!
LOVED the atmosphere and the open air setting.  Food was delicious, we will definitely be going back and even pick up dinner on the way home from work!

Great spot for a healthy and hearty bite to eat! Ordered an a√ßa√≠ bowl and split it with my boyfriend. Food is a bit pricey but servings are above average so I can't complain. Would definitely come back again to try something new!

I like the atmosphere, and they also have very friendly staff.  I live nearby, and so go there a fair amount for coffee, lunch and light shopping.  I find their food to be good, and I like the atmosphere, and the friendly staff.  I guess the only complaints I would have are the lack of parking and fairly high prices.  I guess you gotta pay more for 'organic' and wholesome' though.

This place gets busy. Definitely a cute/fun/hip place to go. Has a vast array of clientele here. If you have a big group it will be hard to find seats all together. 

Good breakfast /brunch type food selection..

Split a wrap with my favorite companion (wife). Nice, fresh, little dry, but a HUNK of turkey can be that way! Love crispy dill pickles, had one of those, couple of BIG strawberries. ALSO split the carrot cake, yum! plenty big to split, nice frosting, great, moist cake. Saw some AWESOME sandwiches being delivered to other tables, will try one of those next time!

This place is unique - maybe a little like La Grande Orange. Both times we've been here it hasn't been very busy. The service was good and food was fresh. They have some vegan options, but only one item labeled as vegan on the menu, the Humm Dinger Vegan Wrap, and it's okay, but kind of boring.

So the only draw for me would be the coffee bar. It's not a place we would drive out of our way to go to, but if we are in the area, we'd stop here for a change.

When the weather is nice and the garage doors are open, it's a nice place to hang out while you eat.

This is a very interesting place, didn't sit and eat but I wanted to!  Food looked delicious, however parking is a bear.  That so far is the only negative or problematic thing I found.  Hope to check out the food at some point.
All day breakfast!  A good stop after some exercise along the canal in the Biltmore area.  Grass fed beef burger and tuna salad tasty protein loads.  Coffee shop.  Juices.  Gifts.

Tried it again, went in for breakfast and thought I would have fresh food.  The potatoes were frozen from a bag, I saw here put them on the skillet in front of me.

Again, dissatisfied with this place, went in expecting more for the money.  Really high prices for same packaged items you can find at Wholefoods or Trader Joes for probably cheaper.

Seriously, one of my favorite places to eat, meet or journal.

People are always helpful and happy :)

You cant go wrong with any of the food - yum!

I love Luci's! The food is fresh, healthy and delicious. They have the ability to make almost any menu item gluten free, which is huge for me.

In addition to the food, the market is super fun! They have wines, freezer items and lots of fun little trinkets. Perusing the market makes any wait for your food fly by.

I personally would recommend getting a bagel with lox, the funky monkey French toast or any Sammie! I don't think any menu item would be a bad choice.

My only complaint is how pricey it is. We rarely can eat here for under $30 for two of us, with gluten free adding $1-$2 per item.

I once again feel the need to sing my praises for Luci's. And more specifically, the weekday morning crew. At some point I bought myself the best supplies to make myself a morning coffee for the road. And sometime a few days ago, I realized that was a damn waste of money. Because I was only going to end up at Luci's. Luci's is where I can go to get a nice dose of sunshine, both weather wise and people wise. Luci's is where I can go and make up my morning song about hot coffee, and rather than have the staff look at me funny, they freestyle right along with me. Luci's is where the name field on the order sticker doesn't say name, but rather says neighbor. Luci's is where I can get breakfast for breakfast, lunch and dinner. And weekday morning Luci's is nice and calm and quiet, which allows me to start the day at my own pace.

Love this place. I'm a regular. The staff are kind and friendly and the kitschy stuff they sell is hilarious. The food and drinks could use an upgrade, esp for the price point but I'll still always come here. The $11 refillable cup is worth it. The iced tea is perfect.

I want to write a love poem for Luci's. And their omelets. That's a weird statement, I know. Even though I've been in this neighborhood forever, I have yet to try Luci's. I was told they have tons of stuff that was gluten free not only in the market, but also in their food section. And they do!

Marketplace. Now, I honestly think that they are pretty overpriced for some of their gluten-free stuff, but they do offer some varieties I haven't seen at a traditional place like Whole Foods or Sprouts - AND this place is super cute too. It's a pretty small marketplace compared to a grocery store, but when you shop here you can get an awesome meal and cup of coffee. 

Eatery. This is my favorite part of Luci's. You can order food or coffee at the Coffee Bar sign. They have tons of stuff - again, the omelets are my favorite - and plenty of treats. Endless choices for coffee too. PS they offer GLUTEN-FREE BREAD. Oh yum yum yum!

Also, be sure to check out their website and sign up for cooking classes. They're a bit pricey - $39.99 a piece, but they sound super interesting. I had to cancel the ones I had recently because of a timing issue, but they sound SO good! 

Why not 5 stars? Well, the parking. I HATE the parking! It's in the weirdest L-shaped shopping center and I had to double-back a few times in order to secure a spot.

I was in the area and I googled places to eat.  I have been trying to eat really healthy, so I decided to try it.  It exceeded my expectations.  I thought the staff was friendly and the food was delicious.  I was blown away that healthy food could taste so good!  All of the items on the menu seemed unique and out of the ordinary, but definitely tasty, organic and good for you.   They also have huge coffees if you are an addict.  I would definitely recommend it and personally return.  Hopefully they will open on in North Scottsdale!

Soy Coconut Latte.....FTW. I can die in peace.

We finally made it here, we are moving to this hood soon so I wanted to see what will soon be a short bike ride away. We only got lattes, and then snooped around the marketplace so I can't vouch for the food...yet.

I am so glad I read Amber W's review or I would have never known about the elusive Soy Coconut Latte. It's not apparent right away what flavors you can have in your latte so I asked and eagerly awaited my coconut delight. My girlfriend got a vanilla latte which she said was good, then she tried my coconut latte. Holy hell, I haven't seen her express so much delight or get that look on her face in awhile(sad right?). I agreed and spent the next 20 min slowly savoring every last drop. 

I love the cups, the material and design keep in the heat and it doesn't require a sleeve - plus it just looks cool. We browsed around the store a bit, everything is impeccably organized, tidy and clean. They have some good stuff that we regularly include on our weekly shopping list, albeit most of it was at a higher price. They carry some local items(Simply Bread, Salem's hummus and pitas, etc) that are hard to find anywhere else, although again they are slightly higher in price. 

I love the open air concept, the people all seemed great. I see people complaining about the parking, maybe some days it is a problem but really people need to get over the typical Phoenix strip mall:  HUGE massive parking lot out front with stores set far back off the street. It ruins the aesthetics and appeal of the store front and isn't as inviting. I will be biking and/or walking here soon(as others should try to do as well) so parking becomes a mute point. If you really have issues with the parking park in the huge abandoned parking lot west of 16th st and walk a couple hundred yards - problem solved.

I didn't see too many vegan items, lots of gluten free stuff but no bakery items or section marked as vegan. I also didn't see much on the menu that was vegan either. I was secretly hoping that since it was called "Healthy" Marketplace it would have more(hasn't anyone read The China Study" ?). A few more vegan grocery and menu items and this place would easily be a 5 in my book; this area is desperately in need of it.

I am not sure which direction Luci's will head, the marketplace is a nice idea, but I am not sure I could see myself buying much in the way of staple items. I could see this place maybe expanding on the cafe and seating and maybe going towards more of the specialty market(read things you CAN'T find anyplace else). I am excited to see where Luci's ends up in the future, I will definitely be back for the coconut lattes and hopefully to try some menu items(I can give you some great vegan ideas - I need a breakfast/brunch spot with options!)
Excellent omelette and coffee. Fabulous atmosphere. Free wifi. Great experience. Excellent service.
Found this little gem, a while back. Have been here about half a dozen times now, always spot on! Gods is delicious and plentiful, and the coffee strong . Nice work

coffee, breakfast to go, bamboo plant gift, vitamin supplement, cooking class, it's all here.

--Great selection of diverse products, all packed into one little corner.
--coffee bar too! great spot when the weather's cool to relax
--houseplants and cool plants for gifts or for your desk at work
--lots of supplements and organic stuff
--one corner has a grill setup with seats 'round it, for demos, cooking class, or for freshly cooked food!

I can't wait to spend an hour in there, just exploring!

Luci's is always fun to visit! They serve breakfast all day and have some of the best coffee drinks in the valley.
The vibe is very casual and laid back and the staff is unbelievably friendly!
They also have a little shop portion in their store with whimsical items. They're great for small gifts or souvenirs if you're a visitor to AZ. 
The only thing I dislike about this place is that if they are busy then expect to have issues finding convenient parking.

This place is awesome! First time here but I will return. Food was great and the atmosphere. I ordered the huevos rancheros with the green lentil pico de gallo it was amazing. There is also a store that sells fun stuff and one of a kind items. The only downside is there is limited seating but the service was awesome!

Worst service I have ever experienced. I stopped in just before 2pm on a weekday. All I wanted was a pre-made sandwich and a basic cup of coffee on my way to an event. There was no line to pay so I was hopeful to be in & out in a couple of minutes. Instead, the cashier was extremely distracted and asked me the same questions twice, she was not even close to listening. It took 20 minutes to put the coffee in a cup, and that was after standing at the pickup counter and asking for it several times. No apologies for the delay whatsoever. I will not be returning and will be deterring others from giving them business.

How can you not love this place??!! 'Goodness for Goodness sake!' and it really feels like that sometimes. When you are out and about needing some lunch and the thought of other fast food places just curls your stomach.. This place, for me, is like a oasis in the desert. I can pretty much just point to anything on the menu and know that I will recognize everything on my plate. Good quality products and the little store is full of recognizable health food brands at reasonable prices. I recognized many things that are lower than Whole Foods! Definitely right on par with Sprouts, but more of a small-town local feel. I love the staff!!! Never hesitating to stop and give encouraging comments or advice on products. All of them super friendly! I can't go often because I live in Gilbert but my grandma lives nearby so I just can't wait everytime I come see her. 

I can see that there is probably lots of people who want lots of stuff for free and to them I say.. Go ahead and get your 10 boxes of pop tarts for $10.. I'll take Luci's and real food any day. Keep up the good work and if you ever open a second location please consider Gilbert!!
Note about the parking: it was crowded both times and both times I did have to circle round back and then back up front but always parked with maybe 2 minutes. 

I have only ever been for lunch but have loved every minute, every bite, every coffee sip and every bit of small talk with the staff.

This is my first ever YELP so be patient.  I was just thinking that I am sick and tired of using "starbucks" as my office away from office and I wanted to find a new place that has access to a patio or some kind of fresh air, internet, and a nice environment to work in. 

Well...By George I think I found it!  Luci's is a mix of a vegan/organic market along with a coffee shop.  It has a giant garage door (think Postino) that is open today due to the nice weather and a full selection of coffee and other type quick bites and pastries.

I settled into a nice couch space by a window and am working away on the FREE WiFi sipping one of the best tasting coffee drinks in town and muching on a organic food bar.

Overall, the place feels good and is comfortable enough top come for a casual coffe and read the paper or hit the office work in a better environment.  Plenty of light to do work and also not too crowded so you can have a conversation on the phone or in person.

The only thing left to be desired is the "barista" wasn't the fastest man on the planet...but this is Phoenix and its more about quality than fast service here.

Oh Luci's.  I really wanted to love you!  Sadly, I cannot.

When you see 'Healthy Marketplace"  there is a certain level of expectation that comes along with that.  Upon first glance at the menu it's pretty obvious that most of it isn't healthy what so ever.  Where are the fresh salads?  How about some quinoa or beets?  Whole wheat pasta?   How about something made with fresh, local ingredients?  I tried a veggie wrap of some kind and it was ok.  Not memorable at all.  And everything is prepared in this tiny 'kitchen'.  It looks more like a demo kitchen!  How can you truly create amazing food if you have no space to do it?
All in all, Luci's is a big disappointment in my book.

Went to Luci's recently with the wife for a mid-week breakfast.  I had thought that the food was going to be just pastries/bagels/etc. but was pleasantly surprised to see they offered 'hot' food.  We both ordered egg/cheese/bagel sandwiches, mine had turkey included with the eggs.  Each also got a coffee.  

The food was good, pretty good sized portion and I thought it was a pretty good value, but my wife and I liked ours.  The coffee was fine, nothing spectacular, but there were four different varieties, including some organic choices, which I liked.  I did not like that the labeling was not great on the creamers, which lead me to having skim milk instead of half/half.  (Probably mostly user error, I'll admit).  

Loved the garage door that was open.  Perfect weather for it, the temperature was great and gave a nice feel.  What I did not like was one of the side effects...flies, and lots of them.  Not sure if there is some way around this (fans?) and also if this is some sort of cleanliness issue (I've certainly been to other places with patios recently that did not have flies buzzing around me the whole meals...don't get me wrong, it wasn't a plague of flies, but near constant buzzing around my food).  The second thing I did not like was the music.  Oh, the selection was fine, but I'm not sure why they had it so loud, kind of annoying.  Plus, in the morning if you have news channels on your tv's in your coffee shop, maybe you could put that audio over the speaker?

Anyways, solid 3.5 for Luci's, though I'm rounding down to 3 stars for the flies/noise.  Might be back, but not sure.

Not sure if they are having a bad day, or short staffed, or just lowered the bar of expectations....I Came into Luci's caf√© today finding the open tables dirty,  food on the floor, garbage can overflowing, air conditioning is either broken or not set at a comfortable temperature.
Went to use the washroom, finding one of them completely out of toilet paper, paper towel on the floor... The next washroom had paper towel on the floor and burnt out lightbulbs.
Disappointing for sure!!

If I could give 10 stars, I would!
This place not only has a great grocery store with a huge selection of gluten free products, but they have an awesome atmosphere cafe with seating throughout the store!!!!! I love this place and the owner is just an incredible guy that goes out of his way to be helpful and turn you into a customer ------- hmm, what do they call that --- oh yeah, CUSTOMER SERVICE - a lost art!!!!! Love this place and they have me as a customer for life!!

Luci's has finally emerged from their growing pains.  In the beginning, the entire neighborhood was pining to love a new locally owned joint.  But like any emo teenager striving to fit in, they swung from one identity to another often, which compromised the consistency and end-product.  After four-ish years however, they seem to have left their pimply pubescent years behind them and offer plenty of good stuff.  The food has been great of late.  One of my favorites is the Turkey Lurkey, a hugely satisfying sandwich of smokey turkey, apple wood smoked bacon, avocado, havarti and pesto piled high on toasty sourdough.  Another great pick is the tuna nicoise salad, and they know a thing or two about making a turkey burger juicy and luscious.  The baristas and register workers are finally with it, and crank out delicious coffees and pastries.  Although the grocery area has improved dramatically in my opinion, it's still a bit pricey for "health" snacks and such (think $7 bags of kale chips).  Make sure you grab a coupon they keep near the register for 15% off 3+ bottles of wine, and pair your grapes with one of their wonderful cheeses in the refrigerated section.

Love this place to get one of a kind gifts, great lattes, a solid omelette, take a cooking class or just to stop by after I've done some shopping at Poor Little Rich Girl.  It's like a coffee shop and home-goods boutique rolled into one.  One point of contention is how cramped the place is.  Every nook and corner is filled with something and waiting in line for your drink you feel in the way with people delivering food, getting drinks, or just browsing around.

The staff is always friendly here!
I love the big selection of teas they offer and my coffee always comes out exactly how I want it.

My only complaint is the wait. It shouldn't take more than 5 minutes to make a latte when there is no one ahead of me.

A good spot to study or visit with someone.

I had one of their omelettes, and an order of their French toast. French toast was cooked just right, with slight crispiness on the outside and warm satisfying bite in the inside. Coffee was just right, just enough kick to start my day.

Another happy 5 star review. I went here last night because I was disappointed with Whole Foods on Tatum. I ran out of Bragg's Apple Cinnamon Vinegar, so I drove up here to stock up. I must say that I was a happy camper. I bought 4 cases and even received a 10% discount. Very helpful staff. Shop here if you need Bragg's products. Definitely the best place to buy them!

Ordered the egg sammy and being vegetarian asked to sub avocado for meat and chose swiss for the cheese that is supposed to come on it.  Arrived with no cheese and 4 very small pieces of avocado.  Had to stand in line to get someone to assist and after they brought it back they had put a very tiny slice of cheese in the egg that was now cold.  Servers apologized that it took so long as they had supposedly been heating it on the grill; why so cold then?  Also ordered a cinnamon roll that they forgot to give us so we had to get up again and wait to get it.  They were very apologetic, but still a bad experience.  They have a great space, but not planning to return for their mediocre food and service.

I wish there was more parking. It's a pretty busy corner but once you get inside you have the option of all day breakfast, sandwiches, salads a coffee bar and surprisingly a grocery store. I ordered the huevos rancheros and it was AMAZING! I felt like the side of lintels should have been served hot but they were still delicious. $15 for the rancheros and a small chai. The chai was delicious. They don't have dome lids so if you ask for whipped cream you won't be getting a full drink. Over all I would definitely recommend this place. It's different, healthy and delicious.

So THIS is what coffee is supposed to taste like!! I have been having coffee at chains for years and thought it was fine. Then I had Luci's latte and am a convert. I live in Mesa now but used to live in the area and I make excuses to come to Luci's for coffee. I've never had any of the food, but it looks great and I love the local atmosphere. Great place - would love to see it thrive!

This is a cute, hipster cafe with a bit of the Oregon coffee-shop vibe. The theme screams "healthy eating" including the desserts I selected from the cookie jar. I stopped in on my walk back to the car after dinner for and the idea seemed perfect. Guiltless cookies to satisfy the sweet tooth after dinner! I was in and out of Luci's really quick so I didn't get a chance to read whether or not the cookies were gluten-free, but I would bet my bottom buck that they were. They were super light and almost flakey and not too sugary. My favorite was the snicker doodle, which was closer on the continuum to a moist shortbread than to a sugar cookie. To me, the sea-salt double-chocolate cookie was a bit salty for my taste, but my fianc√© liked it. 2 gourmet cookies on the go for under $3 is a good deal!

I don't know. It's okay, but I don't think it's anything special. I like shopping local like the next Gen Y kombucha drinking rescue dog owner, but the prices are too high, the layout isn't cohesive, and it's cramped and tiny. It's bodega meets whole foods, and that's cool and all, and I hope it stays open and busy, but... but, I guess I'm cool with my TJ's/AJ's/WF circuit I'm currently stringing on.

First time going to this wonderful little market place and eatery. Had breakfast before work and it was quite pleasing.  I got a egg & sausage sandwich on english muffin.  Tasted like something from the my own kitchen.  Just wonderful. Service was great too. I believe the manager was sitting next to us eating her own breakfast and was talking to us about the place.  Very nice, and I promise you we will be back!  Thank you!

I haven't been here for a while so I decided to meet a friend here for breakfast. The atmosphere is always good so I was looking forward to it. My friend got a green tea smoothie and she couldn't finish it saying it was disgusting, I tasted it and agreed. She ordered the three egg breakfast. How could you go wrong with that? Our order came to our table, again very disappointing. Over cooked eggs, wet barely warmed deli ham, not ham steak, and not even browned on the flat top. Toast wasn't even toast, it was barely warmed bread. The potato medley was hardly cooked with no flavor, no seasoning and no caramelization crunchy goodness.
