I mean seriously, how can you show no love to an innocent potato. I ordered the breakfast sandwich which sucked! It was an over cooked bacon omelet with barely any cheese on an English muffin that wasn't even toasted. Really?!? They weren't really even that busy considering it was a Sunday breakfast rush. It's like their Chef could care less about the food he/she puts out. Worst thing of all my friend calls me 20 minutes later telling me she threw her breakfast up on the way home, poor thing. Now that's saying something about their food! Stay away my friends, steer clear of Lucie's by all means necessary.

Checked out luci's at the orchard and then couldn't pass up coming to the marketplace! Love it! Great options for someone with both gluten and dairy allergies. Would highly recommend. And also just a fun place to grab a small "just because" gift for someone.

Loving this place. Was like a smaller Wholefoods Market in regards to fresh cooked food station & additional prepackaged goods, kids items & organic hygiene & household products like Meyer's. 

You order at the counter just inside the front entrance whether or not u are ordering sit-in or take-out. Menu is on the wall to the right. Cashier staff was quick & friendly. Then u take your # to your seat & either walk around to look for additional take home items or hang out for a very short wait for your food. 

I had the Huevos Rancheros, which I ordered w/ my eggs scrambled - I have no desire to eat raw embryo. I also ordered a side of potatoes, which they call the Signature Seasoned Country Spuds. It's basically every type of potato, including sweet potato & excludes boring old russets. Lightly salted & some other seasoning, not oily or over cooked. Really tasty. Hubby had the Krabby Pants Omelette, which he admitted was quite a fitting description of his old geezer personality. See the detailed food descriptions on one of my attached pics or on the full website menu. I also had the fresh squeezed OJ, Hubby had lemonade. Neither had ice since they were nice & cold - both appreciated. Hubby also had the Double Chocolate Sea Salt Cookie. Hold on to your britches, but that was the item he like the most. Imagine that??

I really enjoyed the whole experience. Food was tasty, beautiful presentation, nice cafe atmosphere, no significant wait to order, friendly staff, clean restrooms & price reflected the overall quality. However, the drinks were a bit pricy when u consider the taste. Just ok.

I've been a fan of Luci's for years now.  I usually come in on the weekends for breakfast to indulge with some Funky Monkey french toast, but today I popped in for lunch.  I had the Hot Juan black bean buger sub vegan cheese and it was super yummy!!  I chose to eat it open and toss the top part of the bun for my own health reasons.  (bread addict in recovery)  The kale topping instead of iceberg lettuce is a nice plus, and every veggie head loves avocado automatically being on a sandwich.  2 thumbs up Luci's, welcome to my lunch restaurant rotation!

Love this spot for the solid breakfast fare, good coffee, perfect atmosphere for a business meeting or a place to stop at after the gym.  They have a bunch of stuff to buy, novelty items and such.  I'm glad this place is around.

This place is like toy story now....
Andy got a new toy and nobody plays with woody anymore. Empty shelves and dirty tables

Food is still great though.  Manager is trying to run around and do it all. She is trying

I love this place ! The food is healthy and BOMB, and all the knick knacks are fun too look at and buy. Highly recommend. The tea is great too. I had a caramel something or other and it was sooo good.

Wife and I went to Luci's this weekend for lunch. I loved the idea after driving by and then checking out the website. I was surprised at a few things. Waiting by the kitchen area to grab a menu, the grill was a freakin mess! We almost left right then. The manager? guy was kind of pestering the chef? to get this next order right. The chef guy seemed very disinterested in listening to him. Kind of weird. 

Food order was wrong. They offered to remake it which was fine. Then the order came back out and they were out of chips this time, so I had to choose a different side. 

Cramped interior. Had to squeeze between tables to the side of the garage door to some baskets mounted to the wall to get plasticware. Just not what I was expecting. Kind of amateurish feeling. 

Won't bother going back.

Went to Luci's today and I'm a fan!  We bought this do it yourself salsa kit and a bag of chips for about 7 dollars, not bad.  I made the salsa today (tomatillo with habanero) and it was really very good, and a lot of fun to make.  The chips were by a company called "Garden of Eatin'" and were better than the salsa!

I can't wait to explore this place a little more.  Skip Starbuck's, and go to Luci's.

Luci's is a great little healthy market in north central area of Phoenix.  We went for lunch one day during the week since they have a little cafe inside the market.  Service is kind of slow, but the food was good. The atmosphere is interesting since you sit pretty much in the market.  It's got a cute "vintage/hipster" look to it.  I love it but want to hate it at the same time. Does that make sense? Phoenix is fast becoming a "Hipster-esk" type of city, and this joint falls right in line with that feel.  I want to not like it, but i do... 

...Ok I'm rambling.  Check them out, the food is good.
Love Luci's! They have the best portobello mushroom burger and happy hour blended drinks are such a great deal. The staff have provided excellent customer service in my experiences.

My go to spot for coffee on the way to my office every morning. Situated on what one could call the coffee corridor with no less than THREE coffee spots at the same intersection.

Coffee is top notch and the breakfast options are enough to ruin anyones diet. Even at a "healthy" marketplace I can destroy my diet.....

Highly recommend. Good coffee? Check! Good Food? Check! Great environment? Check!  Plus they have a great selection of craft and local brews. I come here at least every other week. Great location. Parking is suspect. But other than that this place is golden.

Luci's is a great little neighborhood store nestled on the corner of 16th St and Bethany Home. They offer a full breakfast/lunch menu (order @ counter, then delivered to table), plus a unique variety of items that you would find in a boutique-esque grocery store. I've only eaten breakfast here, and many times at that as well as quick stops  for their coffee or a six pack of cold ones. The strawberry waffles were very enjoyable, and the Mrs said the hash browns (mixed with sweet potato hash browns..mmmh!) and the yogurt parfait were also very good. 
They have garage style glass doors that are raised during non summer months that allow for a great breeze and view of this busy little intersection.
The parking is a bit of a disappointment but I guess you cant win them all. After breakfast or lunch swing by Dick's next door for a drink or wander over to Poor Little Rich Girl for some boutique shopping, great neighborhood spots, wish there were more of them.

It's so nice to find another local place to have breakfast! However , a few things I found annoying and I've only been there twice.  Each time I've been there on a weekend morning, one of the registers was not working correctly.  Menus are not easily accessible until you get to the counter to order.  This can be really annoying because either you know what you want or you have to wait a few minutes until the people in front of you decide what they want to eat while 5 people behind them are waiting patiently.  And the cashier is pretty slow.  The pricing seemed reasonable however it was $8.99 for french toast (3 pieces-no bacon or saugage included) and around $2.50 for their organic coffee.  The food came out hot and looked great although it was way sweet to me.  Too sweet to actually finish and I love french toast but not Luci's.  I will give them another try because it's local and close to my house.  I heard there's Jazz on certain nights, so will have to try out dinner.
coffees pretty good and staff is friendly

Really good food with fresh ingredients. I had the Hummdinger and I am now going to dream about it in my sleep tonight. The only downfall of this place is that it is always so crowded.. And a little pricey. But I suppose you are paying for quality ingredients. Worth it.

4 star service 2 star food = 3 stars.

The bfast potatoes were undercooked and obviously microwaved, not grilled.

The bacon was just OK.

The prices are HIGH, both for the menu & the grocery.

Wi-fi is unreliable.  When it goes out, it takes them 15-20 min to reset it.

Great friendly service.  Nice, sunny outdoor seating.

Goodness for Goodness' sake! Luci's is awesome, the slogan is correct. The market portion carries great local and regional items and contains all sorts of sundries (produce, spices, dairy, hand cream and beer and wine). I always find something unique to take home for dinner. 

My much loved breakfast is the burrito bomb  - scrambled eggs, chicken chorizo, sweet potatoes and cheese wrapped in a sundried tomato tortilla and served with spicy salsa. It is heaven. 
There is a roll up garage door that is almost always open making the atmosphere very inviting. The coffee is strong and the service is top notch, this is my favorite spot for a quick breakfast!
Spent the evening with wife in bathroom vomiting + diarrhea after having a 'doctor' sandwich and chop chop salad today for lunch. I am hoping my 9 months old who had grilled chicken won't get sick :(

The coffee is great, the store is fun and unique, but that's not the most important part. Everything on the menu comes in a gluten free option! From all of my gluten free friends I have learned that getting French toast or a waffle is not generally an option. Here at Luci's you can get everything gluten free. Even the bagels and wraps. I absolutely recommend a drop in if you're ever in the area. The produce used in their food is super fresh and high quality too. My breakfast burrito this morning has types of potatoes I didn't even know existed in it.

Great place for a healthy breakfast. The food is so good! This place has so much charm as well!

They are a market, fun toy/book shop, coffee bar, healthy diner all in one. A great place to stop for a coffee and pastry or breakfast, lunch, and dinner! 

Their customer service is good they are always really nice and quick!  I have ordered their omelettes which are super good and the potatoes they make with it oh my gosh delicious! 
I have also tried their acai bowls and I am addicted them. You definitely have to order one! 
Their breakfast burritos are really good as well. 
Their coffee is really good I typically order a cold brew. 
Parking can be a pain as this place is located in a high traffic area. Specially during lunch. However the vicinity they are in dies have a huge lot as well as another lot across the street. 
A must try if you are in the area!

What a disappointment.  I pass by Luci's a lot and always say "one day I'm gonna stop in."  Well that day came and I wish I had saved my $18.  I ate as much as I could bear, about half.  So for $18 I was half full.  

Before I tell what I purchased, let me say that the place is way too crowded.  There's a diner-like section with seating area, grocery aisles, non-grocery knickknacks, coffee bar with seating area, patio.  I'm sorry, the floor space is poorly designed.

I had to ease on down the twisty winding road to go place an order.  And what a tight spot that was!

So, a slice of "mile high" carrot cake set me back about $5, (maybe $5.50).  Please stop calling it Mile High. It was only three regular layers of cake with just a sugary  white layer of frosting.  The size was not mile high, and the taste did not take me high either.  It'll do, though, if you're longing for cake.

The wild salmon with pesto was $11.  I asked for a wrap instead of bread.  It looked good, but was completely overcooked and I could taste no pesto at all.  I opened the wrap and found a smear of green oil, so the intent of pesto was there, but 'twas a worthless effort.

And the side of tater tots...Ummm, how can I put this nicely?  Fyuck!  They did not taste freshly made.  I should have opted for the side of fruit.  Oh well, next time.  Oh wait, there won't be a next time.  I've done the Luci thing.  No need to do it again.

I am obsessed with the BLT, I seem to always find a must have trinket or food item at the register, i love the Bethany Hm employees, several have been there for a few yrs & greet customers by name (such a nice touch!) the burger (hangerover remedy) & monkey bread French toast, mouth watering!!!

I've heard lots of good things about Luci's over the past few years, and had it on my mental checklist of places to go and check out here in the valley of unique and cool places.  A few months back, they were on Channel 3 during their Saturday morning broadcasts.

Parking here's a bit limited, but not bad.  I imagine if you were to come here on a busy week night it might be different, but overall not bad.  I walked in and really liked what I saw.  Cute setup, with a little bit of this and a little bit of that. Healthy without the feeling of eating or being sold bark instead of real food.

I initially wanted dinner, but decided on a bagel with cream cheese instead.  Here's where they loose a star.  ok, so on their menu, they have a bagel, cream cheese and lox combo for $6.99.  It comes with the onions, capers, tomato's and everything else that normally goes with a plate like this.  Well, I told the girl that I just wanted something lite, and if I could get a bagel with lox and cream cheese only.  She told me it was $8.99?  um, Can't you sell me the $6.99 bagel lox n cream cheese thing and leave the capers out of it? Why the extra $2?  Maybe I misheard...but if I didn't, that's kind of weird!  Why wouldn't she just sell me the $6.99 one?

Anyways, I ended up going with just a bagel and cream cheese with lemon water.  Bagel was great, and the cream cheese with whipped and appeared to be made in house!  They also serve breakfast all day, which I thought was awesome!  Totally my gig, as I sometimes like to mix it up and have breakfast for dinner on the weekends.  

Place is wonderfully decorated, staff was extremely helpful and friendly.  Bathrooms are pretty cool and clean for the most part.  I will say, I absolutely love how this place is decorated.  Totally my style.

Repeat dessert visit last weekend. I brought a group with me this time so we could try a bit more.

This Time:

Carrot Cake:
Moist, earthy, amazing delicious cream cheese frosting and not overly sweet. Very good and up there with the better ones I've had in phoenix.

Super Double Triple Chocolate Crazy Delicious Brownie Cupcake:
Sadly I don't remember the actual name of this but it was very good. They had another variation with walnuts but another member of the party had an allergy so we opted for this version. Death by chocolate for sure. One of those treats you can feel spike your insulin as soon as it hits your mouth. Splurges like this are what make life worth living. Don't deprive yourself of this type of thing just behave the rest of the time :)

Giant Cinnamon Bun:
This was a cinnabun on steroids, over twice the size and I think much better. Had a nice glob of icing in the center. The girl behind the counter insisted that she get to warn it up for me. She used some ridiculously cute phrase to describe how much more amazing it made it. In fact both times I've been in there she has cracked me up. Ah cute coffee girls.. you make my days a little better.

I love close by but don't come here enough! Yesterday, I had the Naughty Nurse melt-gluten free with a large green tea. Enjoyed the atmosphere and the food. The service was excellent. Going to come back more often!

Oh Luci's, I am so in love with you. 

Your delicious soy coconut lattes, your delightful selection of vegan, gluten free items (in store and on menu), your cooking classes (I cannot wait to try one!), your friendly staff, and your beautiful, open, airy environment make you perfect.

Even better is that you are on my way to work and just a bike ride away from my house! This will be helpful because I need a way to even out all the calories I am drinking in these lattes!

I honestly have not a complaint... this really is true love!
The store was really cute and the food was pretty good. I stopped by to kill some time and it was really well worth visiting.
Great local place.  All the food is good big thanks for the Gluten free options and stevia for my coffee.    perfect location for fast meeting or morning cup.

This place is adorable. I love the fact you can get your coffee with Almond Milk or any milk in the store. They offer a true non soy vegan option that is hard to find anywhere in the city. The store is willing to order anything you are looking for that they do not have in stock. 
Would recommend this place for anyone!
Amazing food! Some of the best french toast I have ever had! The staff is great particularly the owners. I would definitely recommend Luci's!

Cinnamon roll was delicious, if a bit dry.

The table at the edge of the door, with the breeze blowing, was fantastic.

The tater tots were pretty good, the burger was very well presented, but was a bit uncooked.

The funky monkey French toast was goddamned amazing! HUGE slices, extra thick. Definitely want that again!

Great atmosphere, great food. Only complaint was our food was quite staggered.

Parking is awful! After several attempts to even find a parking spot, we just gave up and left. It was around 10am, so it wasn't during peak breakfast or lunch times. Parking is easier in downtown Phoenix than here!

Located on the northwest corner of 16th St/Bethany Home. The spots are very tight and face one direction. So, you would want to be driving south along 16th street, then pull in for a better chance of finding a spot. Forget it!

I like to support small business, but any business owner should really consider the parking situation before finalizing the location of business.

I've been wanting to check this place out and when on the way home from a training and hungry I decided to try it. Parking was easy which was nice. The gift shop was terrific with really great gifts (I especially loved the super irreverent ones!). I ordered a kale salad and foibles it down in a flash. There were lots of healthy and yummy choices. I loved the super stylish vibe which made me want to live in this area which I think is the coolest section of Phoenix. The Vig is across the street so I walked over to check that out as well.

Luci's is my all time favorite! They have options for everyone in the family. Lots of gluten free and vegetarian options. Their kale salad is super delish! Also fun to shop for one of a kind little gifts after you eat.

My running group and I love Luci's after a long run. This morning I ordered the KRABBY PANTS OMELETTE which was delicious but holy hell full of oil and calories. I didn't eat the potatoes that came with it. I did eat the little ramekin of fresh fruit that came with it. This meal was like 750 calories. I'm glad I ate it earlier in the day, I have the rest of the day to burn some of that off.
What an incredible place! I've been going here for 3 years and only have nice things to say. Keep up the good work!!

The veggie burger was really great!
I like the little colored potatoes as the side.


Cool little things for sale too!

Love to turn my friends on to this place. They always dig it!

The coffee tastes terrible. Food is mediocre. $12.99 for a beeakfast burrito? Doesn't taste much different than Los Favoritos where you can get 3 breakfast burritos of the same size for that price. Sure the atmosphere and decor are great, but that's all this place has going for it.

I really like this place!  I met a friend here for lunch on a Saturday, and it was busy, for good reason.  Really fresh food, both breakfast and lunch options, and turned out quickly.  Ordering is done in line, which helps the crowd to move quickly.  The only downside could be finding a table during busy periods.  On top of that, it has a really cool neighborhood market attached as well.  Parking can be a struggle as well, due to the corner location,  but trust me, worth the little bit of effort to check this place out.

Have driven by this place several times and it looked like a pretty cool place.  Was in the area and figured I would stop by for a morning beverage and breakfast.  Upon entering, the place is a little smaller than expected and it was very busy at 9:30am on a Sunday.  You order at the coffee bar and the line moves quickly.  Gave the breakfast sandwich a try - interestingly; it was basically and omelet folded over and put between a bagel.  The flavor was good but the texture was much different than what you would expect from a traditional breakfast sandwich.  It was a fun place to checkout but probably wouldn't return back.

I absolutely love the location of Luci's, as it's just a walk from my apartment. I would love to give this eatery 4 stars, but it seems every time I stop in the prices go up. The food is good. I usually get the Spaniard omelet with a fresh orange juice. It's tasty, but nearby at Dick's Hideaway you can get a huge breakfast for not much more money. The retail store portion of Luci's is adorable and I love their random and weird finds! A great place for coffee and a snack!

Okay wow this place is cute and makes an amazing veggie sandwich that even me, a hearty meat eater, can get full off of! The Naughty Nurse is jam packed with a combination of veggies and sauces that go very well with the crispy wheat bread it comes on. I suggest getting the pasta salad for a side! This was the perfect lunch break spot AND they have the coolest store that sells everywhere from farmers market type food to stuff you would see in the apartment section of urban outfitters!

Finally made it over to Luci's today and will definitely be back.  Best cappuccino I've had in years!  My husband got the day's breakfast special--egg and chorizo breakfast tacos--and my kid thoroughly destroyed one of the blackberry honey bran muffins.  Everything was delicious, service was great. Can't wait to come back!

I love the food here. Every time I've come I have enjoyed the food. BUT, getting my fiance to come here is a struggle. The parking is horrendous, there is always a massive line, and there really isn't enough seating. This makes for a sort of chaotic visit at times. On the other side, they have lots of delicious healthy options that taste hardy and they have lots of cute little quirky gifts that you can browse while you wait on your food/drinks if it's to go. Overall, I'm a fan. I just wish they had more space.

This review is only on the food. The atmosphere was great and the health store looked cute but I did not spend time looking around. It was my first time there so I got fresh squeezed orange juice and a crab omelette. My friend got the portabello mushroom burger. For spending 15 dollars and the place was packed, I was excited for my breakfast. The waitress was lovely and I will will probably try it again because the people were very friendly. Getting to the point, my omelette was okay but nothing special and pretty small compared to most breakfast places. The potatoes looked beautiful but they came out very mushy actually all the potatoes were super mushy like frozen and microwaved tasting so it was disappointing. My friends mushroom was under cooked and the avocado was way under ripe so overall we were all disappointed with our food. I would expect some fresh food in a health market but nothing was very appetizing. I may go back to check out the market but for the price will not do the food again.
Worst breakfast I've had in recent memory. Basted eggs hard and cold, roasted potatoes cold and hard -I think I got the leftovers. I'm super disappointed. The coffee; however, is on point.
I love this place! Egg Sammy and pancakes are wonderful as are the smoothies!  neat ambiance too!

Checked out Luci's today. Great food, quick service for how busy they were. The naughty nurse sandwich was very tasty, the hubby had a breakfast burrito which was decent and our 5 yr old had the kids pancakes with fruit which were outstanding. Don't order the Tator tots as they are nothing special but the side of pasta salad was very nice with good flavor includes asparagus, peppers and tomatoes. They have fun different flavored sodas and lemonade as well as a coffee bar and don't forget the $3 Mimosas. Everything else though seems a bit pricey. We had a great meal and will be back.

I stopped in after Mass yesterday with my friend Meaghan.  We try to pick a fun different place each time.  Luci's was on the agenda this week and what a nice little surprise!   It's a mix of a market and cafe with interesting seating and stylish decor.  It's very open and I loved sitting next to the big garage door wall with all the windows.

They have an omelet station where you can pick the size and what you'd like in it.  I chose the Moe cuz I was hungry!!  Was up at 7, did a killer yoga class at 9, went to Mass at 11 and was completely ravenous by the time we arrived.  The Moe omelet was eggs, choice of cheese, choice of veggies and choice of protein.  There were at least 8 veggie selections and if I wanted to I could have had all of them.  I picked mushroom, spinach and onion with bacon for the proteing.  It was served hot, fresh and with a side of nicely salted potato cubes.  It was the perfect size to fill my starving belly.

I'll definitely be back to try the pastries (50% off after 5pm daily!) and some of the ready to take meals.

Luci's is a good neighborhood spot to buy your health foods, drop in for a coffee or fresh made baked good, or pick up some beer or frozen meat on the way home.  I agree with Pamela's sentiment about it being a marriage of TJ's and Hi-Health with AJ's prices. 

I've had a couple of bad cups of coffee here, but in the 10-12 times I've been they have always been very nice and have remedied any problem very quickly. If it wasn't on my route, I may not stop here much though. Trader Joe's and Hi-Health are right next door to each other at 20/Camelback and you can save a ton of money if you do it that way!

Had a friend bring home sandwiches and sides from here when I was sick about a year ago. I remember it being a very tasty lunch with only the freshest highest quality ingredients. I am eager to visit Lucy's in person.

I ordered my regular Soy Coconut Latte - it wasn't the same. It was still good, but not as good as the countless times I had ordered it in the past.

Additionally, I had ordered the lemon burst cupcake which the cashier repeated back to me but never charged me for or gave me. Since I wasn't charged for it I decided it was a sign that I didn't need it!

I had come to do a little work on my laptop. I love my laptop but the battery life SUCKS and I had to sit somewhere with a nearby outlet. The table that I wanted to sit at was dirty.
For the entire two hours I was there.

If this was my first, I would have given it 3 stars, but since I know this was all just a fluke, and that Luci's is better than this experience, I will give it 4. 
But only 4 for this experience. It is still a 5 star coffee shop to me!

This is a 3.5 star review rounded up. This place reminds me a lot of La Grande Orange. A small marketplace with healthy, expensive, rare organic gluten free stuff that doubles as a restauraunt/cafe. There really is no ambiance, i mean you are basically eating in a grocery store, but they play good music, have fresh, flavorful food. There breakfast and lunch are very good and reasonably priced for the amount of food you get. They also sell a lot of local and hard to find items in the market, but beware as it is pricey.

I wish I was closer to this place because I would visit more often. This is a great local coffee shop in a neighborhood that is growing.  The coffee and food is great.  My one problem with the place is the parking.  The last time I was in the neighborhood, I had to drive around several times to find a parking.  I love that this is a coffee shop and market.  They offer diverse products that you would not find in other stores.  Check this place out and grab a cup of coffee.
Me and my wife went there after church yesterday. it was a great good food, great service, even when they had computer problems, we sat outside it was really cool.

Really cute cafe/shop. Food was really good. And I loved all the cute stuff between the store and the tables. It also had grocery and other healthy items in the shop area. We want to go back and try some more food.
5 STARS!!! I was able to find vegan options AND they accommodated to my request of having veggies stir fried in avocado oil!!! Love love love!!!!! And, everyone was super nice :-)
Great healthy choices. Lots of salads and sandwiches. Great breakfast too. Staff is always friendly...both locations can be bit crowded.
Staff is great, food is Okay, this place is just busy and if you have time to kill and just want to get lost in the day, this is the place to go. Pry wont go back.

Qualification - I am rating the Healthy Marketplace side and not the coffee bar:

Just left a movie and wanted to pick up something quick/easy to go - drove by Luci's the other day so I stopped there to grab some chow.  The space itself is cool and has potential.  But...

1.  Many of the goods are the same as in the grocery (some stuff from regular groceries, other stuff from Sprouts/Trader Joes type places) but they cost more.  Five or six bucks for some healthy cereal.  In particular I was disappointed in the wine.  I guess its just my style, but I like a variety of affordable small-production wines.  They had small production wines, just not cheap.  And then they had the same Clois du Bois red wine that has been on sale for $8.99 in Fry's/Albertsons/Safeway for the last five years, except here it was $13.99.
2.  Grabbed a chef salad and a meatloaf sandwich to go.  Salad looked good (and was) - big pieces of chicken and egg - but,....   No dressing!!  The meatloaf was Ok at best, the bread was probably sliced and placed in the box 8 hours ago, and it came with 2 wedges (wedges for a sandwich?) of tomato and two little tiny strings of roasted red pepper.

I had high hopes based on the name/location/etc., but I was disappointed.  Maybe try some quirky grocery items and wines?

Food is very healthy and tasty. Trying to get lunch there every time we in the area. My daughter is vegan and they do have that option. The only tip to follow is that when they ask u if u want the receipt get it. some times they forgot to give u small baking goods right away and it is hard to proof that u bought and paid for it. 
Other wise I would definitely recommend this place and I love this place. 
Also they have a store on a side with lots of organic and vegan food and other merchandise. 
Little bit expensive, but good things are. 
" not all expensive things r good , but all good things expensive "

Hipster hangout, that's the best way to describe this place. But the food is excellent and service is very fast and extra friendly. I like the coffee, it's a nice light roast and it's organic. Most of the omelettes and breakfast dishes are a little pricey for me as a daily routine, so I order the medley potatoes with an egg on top, which runs about $4. But you can get a "fancy" breakfast that would feed 2 skinny Europeans for $10, so that's a good deal too. Eat here or don't, but do visit! It's the most interesting touristy place I've found in Phoenix so far!

Um wowza this is the best place to come after a hike, to study, or just to grab brunch. My go to is the gluten free bread with the salmon sandwich... DROOOLLL!

They have great iced tea's and everyone is absolutely wonderful. 

More on my blog

https://chloefreedomblog.wordpress.com/

Turkey Lurkey.....BOMB!  Great service, friendly and helpful staff!  That being said, I have some beefs...Healthy to me is low calorie, low sodium and low fat.  You can't douche your veggies in butter and throw mayo on every sandwich and be considered "healthy" in my book.  Labelling everything with "organic" or "all natural" doesn't make it healthy.  Cool stuff in the marketplace but too pricey.  I will return due to the taste but not the "healthy" tag.  On a side note, the people who eat here are also very nice to look at.  Eye candy and a great tasting meal = a very nice lunch break.

Luci's is a one of my favorite places to stop in. From the culture to the food it's an A+. They have a great menu that includes an all day breakfast, sandwiches/burgers (hot and cold), salads and a coffee/smoothie bar. There green tea is so my favorite along with there naughty nurse sandwich and kale salad. The atmosphere is adorable and I love the market place, you can find some
Cute gems. If you have not checked this place out your missing out for sure. 
Ps. The people that work here are delightfully kind and always make my day brighter. I work in the restaurant industry and you don't find many places with good food atmosphere and employees and this place has all three and more.
Friendly staff and good customer service. Tried the Grassfeed Luci Burger and it was good.

This is a very busy spot (well each time I have been here) - I've come for breakfast a couple times.  My initial visit was with a friend in the area who is a regular.  Each time I've been its been a good time I will agree - that's more the company though.  They have some great items for sale - including rare gags (a bit pricey as appears all the produce/products in the store).  Parking is a problem during busy hours.  To the food... Its just been ok in regards to the breakfast food - understand I've kept to standard breakfast foods though (eggs, muffins, sausage, potatoes).  The potatoes were cold in the center this visit - so claims that they come out of a bag frozen are pretty much solidified for me.  Last visit my friend got a wrap and I had a bit of food envy.   Its a unique enough experience that I will go back, its a nice place to have a talk/drink when you can get a seat.  I'll try a wrap next time.

The guy at the counter on Saturday got this one an extra star. He was super nice. I dont really understand this place and I want to because i LOVE LOVE LOVE their graphics & neighborhood. But when I go in I don't see anything I really want (and there is always something I want/need) Doesnt look like they make their own pastries, and scone was no bueno. Wish they had more healthy breakfast items like fruit, granola combo deal or oatmeal, or better looking muffins. Or if they made carrot juice or something you cant get anywhere else like that. Or hmm. I don't know. I'm going back. I want them to kick ass!!

I have been here a few times now for breakfast with friends. It is always packed and parking is a bear. Either park across the street or behind the plaza. Anyhoo, I love their iced coffee!! I thought Starbucks was strong, this blows them out of the water, great coffee. I had the Breakfast burrito, it was huge. I was hoping by the menu it would be great, it was ok, the sausage was ok, they did use alot of different types of potatoes, sweet, russet and some type of purple kind so it pretty much sucked up all the moisture out of the burrito. The salsa on the side was average but was not nearly enough for the whole burrito. I would suggest the iced tea..soooo good. It is a great little place, especially when they open the doors and luckily a breeze blows in. They are also pet friendly.

I love this neighborhood and one of my favorite places to go when in the area is Lucy's.  The store sports a combination of espresso bar, healthy and gourmet grocery store and natural "drug" shop.

The staff is most friendly and makes wonderful espresso drinks. Lucy's also offers breakfast and lunch as well as a vast selection of to go items. There is a large sit down area as well as bar where you can enjoy your food and access the complimentary internet wi-fi.

This place opens super early, which I definitely appreciate and service is way beyond friendly (in a good way :D).  I had the breakfast burrito with bacon and avocado & a vanilla latte that set me back $5.25(!).  I'm not really a coffee snob -- mostly a Dunkin' Donuts coffee kinda gal -- and this was nice & smooth, but certainly not $5.25 nice.  Now I looove breakfast burritos, and this one had an awesome variety of local potatoes in it + sweet potatoes that made this a nice little burrito.  There was no avocado on my burrito though, but it was easy enough to let someone know, and they gave me a few slices.

The ambiance is super cute, and I like all of the organic/natural/pretending to be organic & natural under the guise of excellent packaging drinks, groceries, and knickknacks that are lying around.  I wanted to try many of the desserts in the counter, but will give them a shot if I ever come back.  Food is a solid 3, but ambiance and friendly service compel me to give this place 4 stars, but ultimately needs improvement for price point.

A girlfriend of mine moved to the neighborhood and I was paying the obligatory post move visit.  We were RAVENOUS. 

She suggested we go to Luci's for dinner. Neither of us knowing whether they actually served dinner. 

Luckily for us they do, until 9 pm and breakfast is served all day. 

We both had our eyes on the same sandwiches- The Zeus and The Juan with a side of sweet potato fries. 

The owner was also present and gave us a little history about the neighborhood, his establishment and the types  of patrons that frequent the store.  Supposedly the mornings are hoppin with single people grabbing coffee so I guess you could mix it up with some young professionals on your way to work. 

The prices for everything were reasonable. Both sandwiches were fresh and delicious. I'd return for another dinner maybe try some breakfast. They serve waffles and I love waffles.

Another visit to Luci's for lunch - delicious, delicious black bean burger with kale slaw.  Really good.  Nice atmosphere, great green tea, nice staff, fun products.  Always nice to have a really comfy place to get good, fairly healthy, food.

I'm here for my first visit. Some really great points, some not so good and some irritating, at least for me.

I got the krabby pants omelet. I'm not a fan of cutesy names - I finished junior high long, long ago. The omelet was good - probably 3.8 out of five. A shade too salty which overwhelmed the omelet elements. The potatoes were also just a bit too salty, but did have several different kinds of potatoes - 4.3.

The small cup of fruit is the best I've had in a restaurant in ages. Everything in it was perfectly ripe and there were a good number of fresh pineapple pieces in it. 5.0.

I got water to drink - I'm really cheap. Breakfast was close to $12 with $1 tip - a bit much.

The decorations and merchandise sorta shoves that cutesy/kitschy vibe down your throat.  Gag. I'm not admitting there are several things I'm considering buying. No, not admitting that. 

A good place for people watching.

Will I be back?  Ummmm . . . Not a great value and not all that healthy.  Those sweets do look very tempting . . . Which is bad, very bad. I probably will be back, but . . .  I'm ambivalent.

Oh, and most irritating of all was the young man who referred to me several times as "young lady".  I'm old enough to be his mother, if not grandmother.  So, I felt patronized and insulted. I considered making some crabby comment to him, but, as an old woman, I've learned to put up with obnoxious,  cutesy whippersnappers. And, yes, I am crabby with a c, not a k - krabby is obnoxious and cutesy.  I may be obnoxious, but certainly not cutesy.

Great place to come and get a bite to eat any day of the week. I especially love their egg creations that they serve all day... Excellent coffee. The staff is very friendly and courteous. Food ticket times are very fast and the quality of the meal is worth the price.

Love to come here on the weekends and get some food and hang out & get some work done on the free wifi. Have been a regular customer ever since I discovered this place.

Really cute atmosphere and friendly staff, and opens up during spring and fall as a great seating area. Coffee and groceries a little over-priced, but the seating area makes up for it. The green tea smoothie is amazing.
Great pick up and go spot - lots of healthy options! I had breakfast burrito which was really delicious and unique! I'd highly recommend it for any vegetarians (you can also add meat).

I really enjoyed my experience at Luci's.  I ordered the beet salad, and it was very tasty.  I left with a Toddy to go, and it was really nice as well.

I enjoyed browsing in the store after finishing my lunch.  They have a lot of really cute things to look at, and they carry Crow's Dairy goat cheese!!!  That's a big one for me!

Hummm where do I start.  I guess I came in expecting more.  Having worked in a couple of successful small locally owned health food market cafe combos while still in college I know what is possible.  
I was truly expecting more health food and suppliments.  This was more of an upscale QT (I like QTs) with a cafe and a mixed bag of suppliments.  It wasdifficult manuvering through the cafe tables and meandering patrons to get to the market section. 
When it came time to check out....maybe I was lost but I didn't find a market only register, just the one at the cafe front was staffed.  It seemed awkward and they acted like they are not used to seeing market items at the register.  
Also remember to bring your own bags.  I bought 8 items, forgot my bag and I had to use their basket to get my stuff to my car and then bring their basket back.  
I did enjoy my fresh squeezed orange juice I picked up for the road.  
I may be back to try the cafe, but I will continue to go to Sprouts for my health food needs.

I just really want to love this place.  It's near my house, cute, with neat stuff in the store and a hip urban vibe badly lacking in this part of town.  But I have gone there probably two dozen times in the last two years and each time I leave in a bad mood because of the horribly disorganized service.  I honestly can't understand how the cashiers can be so distracted, unless having ADHD is part of the requirement to get hired here.  And as for other commenters who have found the staff "friendly," I have not really noticed that.  They aren't unfriendly, but they are in my opinion, much too spacy to really be friendly in any meaningful way.

Although, it has belatedly occurred to me that maybe they are all just high...

I love Luci's. I'm lucky enough to live in walking distance, so I've been several times and never been disappointed. Food is great, the people working there are really friendly and helpful, they are a community-oriented place in a sea of money-oriented places - I love Luci's. The Burrito Bomb, the Turkey Lurkey and the potato salad are some of my favorites.
Cute kinda novelty vibe stuff and some expensive grocery items. Food isnt all that great but its a good vibel with tons of cool knick knacky things you wont find anywhere else. Worth a trip.

I stopped by at the recommendation of a friend and found the staff friendly, helpful, and expeditious. The coffee I had was just the right mix of strong, and not too sweet.  Their pastries were exceptionally tasty.  They are apparently done by a company called 'Wicked', and Slade Grove (The Owner apparently) was there, and was also exceptionally friendly, and mentioned a Peanut Butter Pudding he was working on.  I am going to have to go back there and try that some time.

I really wanted to love this place,  the people were great!  But the food was so so.  I ordered  the burrito bomb with turkey,  and half of it was filled with ham. Unfortunately i haven't been a pork eater in over 15 yrs so my stomach wasn't so happy after i figured out what that peculiar taste was in my burrito.

I went here the other day and was treated so rudely by manager and staff I wanted to jusy run out.  It seems people working here look down on single men.  From calling me honey to ignoring me to disrespecrltful dialogue, I will not be coming back.  This place has gone downhill.

Very nice selection of good quality dishes. As always, "healthy" can easily be undone by cheeses, mayo, and other yummy additions so be careful if your idea of "healthy" is low cal or low fat. The sammiches were fantastic, the dill potato salad - yummy!, and the tots were pretty good. The market itself has a nice selection of items that you don't usually find often in regular grocery stores (five+ types of quinoa! ;)). I'll definitely be back, whether for a specialty grocery item or for a great meal.

Loved this place, its different kinda like eating at a whole foods or co-op but really yummy for sure. Their drink selection is as good as their food with many new or hard to find elixers as anywhere. Tried the greenchile pannini and it was bomb! Can be a lil crowded during the lunch rush so take someone with and have them hold down ur seats as the other makes the order as they dont have waitstaff.
We're new to town, but simply put...having a place like this in town makes us real happy. Great selection and ambience, awesome staff, not the greatest prices but that's expected.

Luci's can leap from Two Stars to Four, in a single visit!

Jaek and I recently hung out at a table in the open garage-door, inside patio type area of Luci's, and we both had a great time. (see photos)

A big reason for this was the friendly and helpful demeanor of Braden, a barista/juicista/pastryista behind the counter.
After eyeballing a red velvet cake slice with cream cheese frosting dolloped up on top that actually had *GLITTER* covering it, I asked how they made edible glitter, or if those were just for show.
He explained about pulverized polished sugar, and after I shared that I have a bonified, legit case of picaphobia (glitter - it's little tiny sharp edged peices of metal or hard plastic, you know, with a mind of it's own, an inability to wash off, a tendency to get men in trouble for indiscretions at the boobiebar, and a seeming ability to reproduce.  I think it may be alive and evil, actually), and that I was taking a huge psychological step in overcoming it by having decided that I was going to get one of those slices and actually eat my psyche's penultimate nemesis, he congratulated me and said that it was on him.  

Well, since he comped that glittercake, I felt allright splurging for a tasty, but still overpriced, big glass of fresh squeezed OJ.

I tried, but couldn't find a single expired meat or cheese item in the fridge case.  I still say it's a weird conglomeration, and a bit pricey, but if I was a local without a car, being able to walk here every couple days would be wonderful.

Oh yeah, the fine folks at Luci's have put up a nice plaque thanking the local firefighters who saved their place from destruction during Richardson's recent burn.

I've been here a few times and it's average. I think the food should be better than the hype and cool factor and it's not. Always food should be first and foremost. Service and lack of the wow factor can be overcome by great tasting "original" food. The fresh fruit wasn't fresh. The sandwich average, nothing over the top for $10.

Luci's never disappoints! Had breakfast there with our friends last weekend, happened that they had crock pot corned beef hash as their special. The best hash I have eaten in a long time! Both hubs and I had it and were delighted. Coffee is wonderful and the ambiance is comfortable. We go early, so not so crowded at that time. Great experience and a good start to the day!

Luci's is amazing! I love coming here for a casual breakfast or lunch. Today I tried the Zeus turkey burger which was delicious. It's a cute little spot in uptown and the perfect spot of a post hike meal. The only down side to this place is the limited parking. Other than that it's great. They have great food and iced tea. They also have a bunch of eclectic and quirky gifts throughout the store. Perfect stocking stuffers for this time of year. If you're in the area and looking for a healthy local meal this is your place!
Healthy, vegetarian friendly restaurant and market.  If you are looking for a healthy meal, funky gift or organic fare look no further than Luci's.  Great place for coffee or tea and a quick snack.
Overall, not too bad. Their food seems decent so far, but not quite worth the price tag. The people at the counter were really nice.

After dropping $100 at the nursery this morning for my new patio, I needed something for breakfast and a nice iced tea.  My neighbors told me about Luci's and I've driven by a half dozen times.
You can build an omelet there by the size: Eeny (just egg), Meeny (egg and cheese), Miny (egg, cheese and veggies), and Moe (all the above with a protein).  I had a piece of spinach quiche.  I also ordered a large iced tea.  Well, I was sipping my tea, waiting for the quiche to be heated.  And waited.  Finally, after bumping into my massage therapist (she's the BEST!), I asked about it.  They had forgotten me.  :{  Oh well, they offered a free Danish to make up for it while they heated up my quiche.  
They have a section of teas and different foods.  It's a small section and the prices are a little higher than you'd find at Sprouts.
I'll be back a million times, since it's so close to home.
Let's hope they don't forget me next time ;}

The breakfast here is always fresh and they have a great garage style door to sit and enjoy your cup of Joe before the craziness of the day begins.  Be careful they have a ton of little knick knacks and gag gifts which, if you're not careful, will ding your pocket book.....leave you saying how did I walk away with a $40 bill.......

The wife, kid and I like to stop in for breakfast on the weekends!  The burrito was awesome! The only negative is some of the prices in the market are a little high, though it does save me a trip to the big stores.

Love, Love Love Luci`s!!
Whether its a stop in for coffee, a sandwich, a delicious brunch or picking up groceries, Luci`s has it all!! They even have live music on Saturday evening and offer cooking classes which I might have to try!
Live nearby so love stopping in here and staff is always great!!
One of my favorite places to go in the neighborhood!! Great coffee and so thrilled to have tasty gluten free options! Also love the variety of things that the marketplace has to offer!

Wonderfully delicious food and great environment. I highly recommend the portobello shroom burger. Staff has always been friendly and helpful every time I've visited. The marketplace within the location is also cute for gifts and such. Definitely one of a kind from what I've experienced in the area. 

The only downside for me personally is the cost. However, in their defense, fresh ingredients and a unique place come with that price. 

As a side note, not everything there is healthy, but they have no shortage of healthy options!!! Great for vegans, vegetarians, and otherwise. Something for everyone!

I had an omelet with turkey chorizo with an English muffin side, excellent presentation and good quality food.  Sorry, so hungry after my work out I forgot to take a pic of my food.  Anyways here is a pic of the inside that has great foot and a small local grocery store full of unique and healthy items.  The heat is finally out of Phoenix so they had the garage doors open which is great but I hate those pesky flies!!!!  I'm gonna have to invest something to get rid of those things for outdoor eating..

Sure it's walking distance from my house - so I was hoping I would have a new place for my morning tea.   After finally re-opening after the fire on 16th and Bethany Home, I was excited to check out Luci's.

The design of the the place is fantastic simple, sexy, a little modern and throw in some retro corner grocery feel.  I was greeted with fun, friendly service, and then left with a great pastry and a tasty ice tea for the road.  

They seem to still be working out some kinks since the re-open, but I see it only getting better.  In fact I just got myself excited.  I think I am going to head over there now for my morning snack.

Super cute laid back spot to grab a bite, shop a little, or meet up with friends. They have a good variety of sandwiches, coffee , and pastries that you'll enjoy. If that's not enough , the market sections are also filled with unique snacks and cool merchandise to tKe home or just look at.

Very cool atmosphere. Had breakfast here and it was really good.  Coffee is great, too.  The vibe is similar to La Grande Orange, but even more neighborhood "market-y."  Focus on healthy, natural stuff (no Diet Cokes, but I can live with that!).  Reminds me of some places I've been to in LA neighborhoods like Silverlake or Abbot Kinney in Venice (for those of you who might be familiar with some of the hip locales in Los Angeles).  Haven't been to Luci's for lunch or dinner, but I just might do that in the next couple of weeks.

The only reason we drove all the way out here was for their "peppermint pancakes"advertised in azcentral.com well when we got here they looked surprised. WTH? We are from out of town looking for something to eat and since I'm addicted to peppermint this seemed like an awesome idea until we got here.... Hungry I just pointed to the next thing on the menu... BUMMED

Service?  Well the dude taking our order wasn't exactly apologetic said something like I should have looked at their Facebook page well d*** I'm not the one who put you on azcentral maybe someone should have corrected them? Just a thought...? The link they had was NOT to your fb page... Trying to ruin my day... I think if he was even fake apologetic it would have been ok I suppose... And their peppermint latte is a hint of peppermint... 

My food? COLD eggs, cold everything SERIOUSLY?!?!?!?

2 stars is for the knock knacks they have around 
If I lived here and this was the service I got I would NOT return... Not worth it. I'm sure there are other healthy food places in Phoenix/Scottsdale area with better food and even better service... UGH

Posting the picture that made me come out here for absolutely NOTHING!

I happened to try this place out two years ago off of a recommendation from a business near by. Since then, I make my way to Uptown from Tempe whenever I can just for Luci's. The food is always amazing, the novelty gifts are fresh and hilarious, the staff members are awesome, and the marketplace is quite good as well. It's a no brainer 5-star review for me. If you haven't been here and are contemplating trying it out, I would highly recommend it.

Love this place! I tend to try to pick up breakfast here on my way to work once a week. Love the egg Sammie! Keeps me full but not uncomfortable full all day! I'd love to go into Lucy's when I'm not in a rush to work. Every time I am in there I find some new product that intrigues me.

Hooray for Luci's.  G-reat coffee, and I will specifically add great service as well.  I wanted a bagel breakfast sandwich with ham (not on the menu) and they actually made me feel like I WASN"T being difficult. 

Now that's how you do it....

I know it might not sound like a big deal---To go see if there is ham available in the kitchen, and then make up a custom egg bagel for a customer's picky breakfast, but it IS a big deal because it is so simple, and so possible, and so often the answer is just  'no, it's not on the menu', because that's just easier.  

My hat's off to Luci's for being awesome.  Made my day.

Such an adorable neighbourhood grocer complete with organic milk in glass bottles... love the boutique feel and open vaulted cafe.. I will be back for food and shopping when I have more time to dig through their organic homegrown riches..

Went today, Feb. 11, 2018. First, got in line and waited. There was a Spanish speaking person next to me and the cashier automatically assumed that my group was with her, she skipped to the next person in line. The cashier attending to the Spanish speaker was to the left of me and the cashier lady was tending to the right of me. She saw me and my group in the middle of the register line awkwardly standing there and didn't ask to help. So finally, the left cashier was done we were able to order. Placed our order, cashier couldn't figure out to split the bill. Had to wait longer. We sat down, and waited drinks never came. I asked the lady, where are our drinks while she was serving our food. She responded with I will make them right now. We ate, and finished our food. Never got our drinks. Asked for my refund, was not offered anything in return. I usually really like this place, like a lot. I have spent a great deal of money here. Just the overall service has gone down.

They got rid of their sweet tots :( this makes me so sad. It was the icing on the cake. I'm sure I'll be back for my hot Juan burger but there is a little hesitation because I don't really love their other side choices.

Nice atmosphere, but that was about it.  Our order encountered turbulence when "the printer stopped working" which caused my breakfast to take over THIRTY FIVE minutes to arrive.  They offered nothing more than a simple apology which was still appreciated.  The Krabby Pants omelet was much over salted and the same could be said about the colorful fries that it came with.  The food was over priced and lacked value.  There is no reason I would come back to this establishment.

I got a gift card for Lucci's and was excited.  The place looked retro-hip with some food, coffee, and natural food grocery items.  The tables could be full many times we went by so today we went mid-afternoon and had some really nice sandwiches.  I had Rosie's roast beef and it ROCKED!  The hubby had the special and between bites said it was good.  We thought the prices were a tad high even though delucious. We got to check out the grocery store portion and it is stocked full with natural, organic and gluten free foods.  Some novelties which were cute. Be warned - there are many urban hipsters about.
Gluten free dining and groceries in one cool place!
Crabby pants keeps me coming back! I love it, not only that the staff is great, they have a great beer selection and organic treats and frozen foods and great juices and kombuchas

Love, love this place!  I discovered it in the same little shopping area with one of my favorite consignment shops. Luci's has a cafe with seating, as well as a healthy "grocery" type area with healthy fare. The cafe has sandwiches, salads, and a great breakfast that's served all day. They have several coffee drinks also. One of my favorite items is the Smoky Joe's BLT, which I always get in a tomato or spinach wrap with a side of fruit. 

The grocery area has lots of gluten-free and vegan items. They also have some novelty items, my favorite of which is a sticky note pad declaring "You're on my Sh!t List" -- dang, that little sticky note pad is damn therapeutic!! 

Parking can be a pain when it's busy, so just be aware...

The Gluten Free French toast is where it's at! 

Love Luci's!

I started going to Luci's right when it opened - the 1st time and was hooked from that point on! It offers great drinks, pasteries, soups, and groceries in a welcoming environment.
I love the pasteries which are made in house and their house citrus green tea is a morning staple at work. The hote breakfast offerings are good, but take quite awhile to make it to your table. I wish tere was more than 1 cook on weekends. The only other issue I've had is parking can be in short supply on weekends since Dick's Hideway is next door.
Luci's has risen out of the smoke and become a great neighborhood staple!

First off, I'm not from the PNW, but I'm definitely a big fan! This little market makes me feel like I'm being transported to New Seasons or Powell's in Portland! *Happy Thoughts!* 

I actually came to Luci's because I found out they carry my favorite brand of Kombucha (yes, Dr. Brew, also from Portland......obviously starting to see a pattern now [insert emoticon here]) But, when we arrived it was PACKED, people eating everywhere! It was Valentine's Day, so I suppose the rush might have been expected (or maybe that's just the norm for a Saturday?) Either way, these people looked like they were really enjoying their food, so, what's a girl to do? Join the bandwagon, of course! 

I ordered the 'Luci's Famous All Natural Burger' (sans cheese). Yes. Yes, I can see why it's 'Famous'..... I mean, absolutely  DELISH.......SOOOO Juicy and flavorful.... in order to be a *perfect* burger, it just needed an ever so slight modification....yeah, that whole "bun to burger ratio" thing, this guy was SO Juicy that my bottom bun became sopped through with juices, meaning it fell apart! If that doesn't bother you, then you are at least in for a very delightful tasting experience! I would order again for sure (for this particular burger, I can live with the soggy bun). I also ordered the house salad with the lovely sounding citrus vinaigrette, but alas, my salad came out completely naked, so I didn't' get to taste it. They were far to busy to ask for a side of the dressing, so I'll just have to try it next time. (hence the docking of one star)

As per customer service, we met Neil, who is related to the owner. What a fantastic guy! Super friendly and helpful, I found out from him that I could actually buy a whole case of my beloved Kombucha and get an extra 10% off the case! PERFECT!!! Addiction is officially fed [big happy emoticon here] I believe they do this deal for various of your favorite beverages, not just the kombucha (I know not everyone is a fan, but boy they SHOULD be!) 

The store itself has some of the regular things that health food stores offer, but they seem to be a little selective of what brands they choose to stock. I was very excited to find Maqui powder, something I keep checking for at Whole Foods and Sprouts, but usually to no avail. So, that was exciting. They also had a lot of cool odds and ends things - think Changing Hands meets Health Food Store - it makes for some fun browsing!
This place has great coffee and a cool retro feel!  The groceries are definitely over-priced but there is a convenience factor in the cost, I'm sure.  The breakfast bar is great for omelettes, etc.
